journal.title: Proceedings of the Indian Academy of Sciences Mathematical Sciences

entry.title: Intermediate Jacobians and Hodge Structures of Moduli Spaces

abstract.p: The mixed Hodge structure on the low degree cohomology of the moduli space of vector bundles on a curve is studied. Analysis of the third cohomology yields a new proof of a Torelli theorem.

author.name: Donu Arapura
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN 47907-1395, USA

author.name: Pramathanath Sastry
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Purdue University, West Lafayette, IN 47907-1395, USA
The Mehta Research Institute, Chhatnag, Jhusi, Allahabad 221 506, India

entry.title: An Intrinsic Approach to Lichnerowicz Conjecture

abstract.p: In this paper we give a proof of Lichnerowicz conjecture for compact simply connected manifolds which is intrinsic in the sense that it avoids the nice embeddings into eigenspaces of the Laplacian. Even if one wants to use these embeddings, this paper gives a more streamlined proof. As a byproduct, we get a simple criterion for a polynomial to be a Jacobi polynomial.

entry.keywords: Harmonic manifolds;Blaschke manifold;mean curvature;Jacobi differential equation;Ricci curvature;compact rank one symmetric spaces;nice embeddings.

author.name: Akhil Ranjan
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Technology, Mumbai 400 076, India

entry.title: Connections for Small Vertex Models

abstract.p: This paper is a first attempt at calssifying connections on small vertex models i.e., commuting squares of the form displayed in (1.2) below. More precisely if we let $B(k, n)$ denote the collection of matrices ùëä for which (1.2) is a commuting square then, we :

ol.li: obtain a simple model form for a representative from each equivalence class in $B(2, n)$,
obtain necessary conditions for two such `model connections' in $B(2, n)$ to be themselves equivalent,
show that $B(2, n)$ contains a $(3n - 6)$-parameter family of pairwise inequivalent connections, and
show that the number $(3n - 6)$ is sharp.

abstract.p: Finally, we deduce that every graph that can arise as the principal graph of a finite depth subfactor of index 4 actually arises for one arising from a vertex model corresponding to $B(2, n)$ for some n.

author.name: R. Srinivasan
author.affiliation: Mehta Research Institute of Mathematics and Mathematical Physics, Allahabad 211 019, India

entry.title: Transformation Semigroup Compactifications and Norm Continuity of Weakly almost Periodic Functions

abstract.p: We prove if there exists a separately continuous action of a topologically right simple semitopological semigroup ùëÜ on a topologoical space ùëã and if ùëÜ acts topologically surjective on ùëã then each weakly almost periodic function on ùëã, with respect to ùëÜ, is left norm continuous.

entry.keywords: Transformation semigroup;left norm continuous;weakly almost periodic.

entry.title: On $(N, p, q)$ Summability Factors of Infinite Series

abstract.p: In this paper a necessary and sufficient condition has been obtained for $\sum_{a_n\epsilon_n}$ to be summable $|\overline{N}, q|$ whenever $\sum_{a_n}$ is bounded $(N, p, q)$.

entry.title: Construction of `Wachspress Type' Rational Basis Functions over Rectangles

abstract.p: In the present paper, we have constructed rational basis functions of $C^0$ class over rectangular elements with wider choice of denominator function. This construction yields additional number of interior nodes. Hence, extra nodal points and the flexibility of denominator function suggest better approximation.

author.name: P. L. Powar
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics and Computer Science, R.D. University, Jabalpur 482001, India

entry.title: A Direct Heuristic Algorithm for Linear Programming

abstract.p: An $O(n^3)$ mathematically non-iterative heuristic procedure that needs no artificial variable is presented for solving linear programming problems. An optimality test is included. Numerical experiments depict the utility/scope of such a procedure.

entry.keywords: Direct heuristic algorithm for linear programming;interior-point methods;optimality test;ùëù-inverse;revised simplex algorithm.

Department of Mathematics, University of Mauritius, Reduit, Mauritius

entry.title: An Approximate Solution for Spherical and Cylindrical Piston Problem

abstract.p: A new theory of shock dynamics (NTSD) has been derived in the form of a finite number of compatibility conditions along shock rays. It has been used to study the growth and decay of shock strengths for spherical and cylindrical pistons starting from a non-zero velocity. Further a weak shock theory has been derived using a simple perturbation method which admits an exact solution and also agrees with the classical decay laws for weak spherical and cylindrical shocks.

entry.keywords: Shock dynamics;compatibility conditions;blast wave;weak shock propagation.

author.name: S. K. Singh
author.affiliation: Centre for Aeronautical System Studies and Analyses, New Thippasandra P. O., Bangalore 560 075, India

author.name: V. P. Singh
author.affiliation: Centre for Aeronautical System Studies and Analyses, New Thippasandra P. O., Bangalore 560 075, India

entry.title: Slow Rotation of a Sphere with Source at its Centre in a Viscous Fluid

abstract.p: In this note, the problem of a sphere carrying a fluid source at its centre and rotating with slow uniform angular velocity about a diameter is studied. The analysis reveals that only the azimuthal component of velocity exists and is seen that the effect of the source is to decrease it. Also, the couple on the sphere is found to decrease on account of the source.

author.name: Sunil Datta
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics and Astronomy, Lucknow University, Lucknow 226 007, India

author.name: Deepak Kumar Srivastava
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics and Astronomy, Lucknow University, Lucknow 226 007, India

entry.title: How to Recover an ùêø-series from its Values at almost all Positive Integers. Some Remarks on a Formula of Ramanujan

abstract.p: We define a class of analytic functions which can be obtained from their values at almost all positive integers by a canonical interpolation procedure. All the usual ùêø-functions belong to this class which is interesting in view of the extensive investigations of special values of motivic ùêø-series. A number of classical contour integral formulas appear as particular cases of the interpolation scheme. The paper is based on a formula of Ramanujan and results of Hardy. An approach to the problem via distributions is also presented.

author.name: Christopher Deninger
author.affiliation: WWU, Mathematisches Institut, Einsteinstrasse 62, D-48149 Munster, Germany

entry.title: RRF Rings which are not LRF

abstract.p: Define a ring ùê¥ to be RRF (respectively LRF) if every right (respectively left) ùê¥-module is residually finite. We determine the necessary and sufficient conditions for a formal triangular matrix ring $$T=\begin{pmatrix}A & 0\\ M & B\end{pmatrix}$$ to be RRF (respectively LRF). Using this we give examples of RRF rings which are not LRF.

author.name: K. Varadarajan
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Calgary, Calgary, Alberta T2N 1N4, Canada

entry.title: Inequalities for a Polynomial and its Derivative

abstract.p: For an arbitrary entire function ùëì and any $r\gt 0$, let $M(f, r):=\max_{|z|=r}|f(z)|$. It is known that if ùëù is a polynomial of degree ùëõ having no zeros in the open unit disc, and $m:=\min_{|z|=1}|p(z)|$, then
$$M(p, R)\leq\left(\frac{R^n+1}{2}\right)M(p, 1)-m\left(\frac{R^n-1}{2}\right), R>\gt 1.$$
It is also known that if ùëù has all its zeros in the closed unit disc, then
The present paper contains certain generalizations of these inequalities

author.name: V. K. Jain
author.affiliation: Mathematics Department, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur 721 302, India

entry.title: Oscillations of First Order Difference Equations

abstract.p: The oscillatory and asymptotic behaviour of solutions of first order difference equations is studied.

author.name: N. Parhi
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Berhampur University, Berhampur 760 007, India

entry.title: Continuous Rearrangement and Symmetry of Solutions of Elliptic Problems

abstract.p: This work presents new results and applications for the continuous Steiner symmetrization. There are proved some functional inequalities, e.g. for Dirichlet-type integrals and convolutions and also continuity properties in Sobolev spaces $W^{1, p}$. Further it is shown that the local minimizers of some variational problems and the nonnegative solutions of some semilinear elliptic problems in symmetric domains satisfy a weak, `local' kind of symmetry.

entry.keywords: Continuous symmetrization;integral inequality;Dirichlet-type integral;semilinear elliptic problem;symmetry of the solution.

author.name: Friedemann Brock

entry.title: Diameter Preserving Linear Maps and Isometries, II

abstract.p: We study linear bijections of simplex spaces $\mathcal{A}(S)$ which preserve the diameter of the range, that is, the seminorm $\varrho(f)=\sup\{|f(x)-f(y)|: x, y\in S\}$.

entry.title: On Vector Equilibrium Problem

abstract.p: This paper presents some existence results of a vector equilibrium problem. The several important special cases of the vector equilibrium problem are also discussed.

entry.keywords: Vector equilibrium problem;KKM-Fan lemma;ùëÉ-monotone and ùëÉ-convex mappings;ùëÉ-maximum monotonicity.

entry.title: Existence of Solutions of Nonlinear Integrodifferential Equations of Sobolev Type with Nonlocal Condition in Banach Spaces

abstract.p: In this paper we prove the existence of mild and strong solutions of a nonlinear integrodifferential equation of Sobolev type with nonlocal condition. The results are obtained by using semigroup theory and the Schauder fixed point theorem.

entry.keywords: Integrodifferential equation;Sobolev type;nonlocal condition;uniformly continuous semigroup;Schauder's fixed point theorem.

Department of Mathematics, Sophia University, Tokyo 120-8554, Japan

entry.title: Poincar√© Polynomial of the Moduli Spaces of Parabolic Bundles

abstract.p: In this paper we use Weil conjectures (Deligne's theorem) to calculate the Betti numbers of the moduli spaces of semi-stable parabolic bundles on a curve. The quasi parabolic analogue of the Siegel formula, together with the method of Harder-Narasimhan filtration gives us a recursive formula for the Poincar√© polynomials of the moduli. We solve the recursive formula by the method of Zagier, to give the Poincar√© polynomial in a closed form. We also give explicit tables of Betti numbers in small rank, and genera.

entry.keywords: Cohomology;parabolic vector bundles;moduli space;Betti numbers;Weil conjectures.

author.name: Yogish I. Holla
author.affiliation: School of Mathematics, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Homi Bhabha Road, Mumbai 400 005, India

entry.title: The Algebra of ùê∫-relations

abstract.p: In this paper, we study a tower $\{A^G_n(d):n\geq 1\}$ of finite-dimensional algebras; here, ùê∫ represents an arbitrary finite group, ùëë denotes a complex parameter, and the algebra $A^G_n(d)$ has a basis indexed by `ùê∫-stable equivalence relations' on a set where ùê∫ acts freely and has $2n$ orbits.

We show that the algebra $A^G_n(d)$ is semi-simple for all but a finite set of values of ùëë, and determine the representation theory (or, equivalently, the decomposition into simple summands) of this algebra in the `generic case'. Finally we determine the Bratteli diagram of the tower $\{A^G_n(d): n\geq 1\}$ (in the generic case).

abstract.p: Two generalized Hankel‚ÄìClifford integral transformations verifying a mixed Parseval relation are investigated on certain spaces of generalized functions for any real value of their orders $(\alpha-\beta)$.

entry.title: $C^2$-rational Cubic Spline Involving Tension Parameters

abstract.p: In the present paper, $C^1$-piecewise rational cubic spline function involving tension parameters is considered which produces a monotonic interpolant to a given monotonic data set. It is observed that under certain conditions the interpolant preserves the convexity property of the data set. The existence and uniqueness of a $C^2$-rational cubic spline interpolant are established. The error analysis of the spline interpolant is also given.

entry.title: Coin Tossing and Laplace Inversion

abstract.p: An analysis of exchangeable sequences of coin tossings leads to inversion formulae for Laplace transforms of probability measures.

entry.title: Differential Equations Related to the Williams-Bjerknes Tumour Model

abstract.p: We investigate an initial value problem which is closely related to the Williams-Bjerknes tumour model for a cancer which spreads through an epithelial basal layer modeled on $I\subset Z^2$. The solution of this problem is a family $p=(p_i(t))$, where each $p_i(t)$ could be considered as an approximation to the probability that the cell situated at ùëñ is cancerous at time ùë°. We prove that this problem has a unique solution, it is defined on $[0, +\infty]$, and, for some relevant situations, $\lim_{t\to\infty} p_i(t)=1$ for all $i\in I$. Moreover, we study the expected number of cancerous cells at time ùë°.

entry.keywords: Williams-Bjerknes tumour model;expected number of cancerous cells.

entry.title: Suppression of Instability in Rotatory Hydromagnetic Convection

abstract.p: Recently discovered hydrodynamic instability [1], in a simple B√©nard configuration in the parameter regime $T_0\alpha_2 \gt 1$ under the action of a nonadverse temperature gradient, is shown to be suppressed by the simultaneous action of a uniform rotation and a uniform magnetic field both acting parallel to gravity for oscillatory perturbations whenever $(\mathscr{Q}\sigma_1/\pi^2+\mathscr{J}/\pi^4) \gt 1$ and the effective Rayleigh number $\mathcal{R}(1-T_0\alpha_2)$ is dominated by either $27\pi^4(1 + 1/\sigma_1)/4$ or $27\pi^4/2$ according as $\sigma_1\geq 1$ or $\sigma_1\leq 1$ respectively. Here $T_0$ is the temperature of the lower boundary while $\alpha_2$ is the coefficient of specific heat at constant volume due to temperature variation and $\sigma_1, \mathcal{R}, \mathscr{Q}$ and $\mathscr{T}$ respectively denote the magnetic Prandtl number, the Rayleigh number, the Chandrasekhar number and the Taylor number.

author.name: Joginder S. Dhiman
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Himachal Pradesh University, Summer Hill, Shimla 171005, India

entry.title: A Quantum Spin System with Random Interactions I

abstract.p: We study a quantum spin glass as a quantum spin system with random interactions and establish the existence of a family of evolution groups $\{\mathcal{T}_t(\omega)\}_{\omega\in\Omega}$ of the spin system. The notion of ergodicity of a measure preserving group of automorphisms of the probability space ùõ∫, is used to prove the almost sure independence of the Arveson spectrum $\mathrm{Sp}(\mathcal{T}(\omega))$ of $\mathcal{T}_t(\omega)$. As a consequence, for any family of $(\mathcal{T}(\omega), \beta)$-KMS states $\{\rho(\omega)\}$, the spectrum of the generator of the group of unitaries which implement $\mathcal{T}(\omega)$ in the GNS representation is also almost surely independent of ùúî.

entry.title: Weighted Approximation of Continuous Functions by Sequences of Linear Positive Operators

abstract.p: In this work we obtain, under suitable conditions, theorems of Korovkin type for spaces with different weight, composed of continuous functions defined on unbounded regions. These results can be seen as an extension of theorems by Gadjiev in [4] and [5].

entry.keywords: Korovkin theorem;positive linear operators;weighted spaces;weight functions.

entry.title: Hyperfinite Representation of Distributions

abstract.p: Hyperfinite representation of distributions is studied following the method introduced by Kinoshita [2, 3], although we use a different approach much in the vein of [4]. Products and Fourier transforms of representatives of distributions are also analysed.

entry.title: Sampling and II-Sampling Expansions

abstract.p: Using the hyperfinite representation of functions and generalized functions this paper develops a rigorous version of the so-called `delta method' approach to sampling theory. This yields a slightly more general version of the classical WKS sampling theorem for band-limited functions.

entry.keywords: Sampling expansions;WKS sampling theorem;non-standard analysis;hyperfinite sums.

entry.title: Formula for a Solution of $u_t + H(u, Du) = g$

abstract.p: We study the continuous as well as the discontinuous solutions of Hamilton‚ÄìJacobi equation $u_t + H(u, Du) = g$ in $\mathbb{R}^n \times \mathbb{R}_+$ with $u(x, 0)=u_0(x)$. The Hamiltonian $H(s, p)$ is assumed to be convex and positively homogeneous of degree one in ùëù for each ùë† in $\mathbb{R}$. If ùêª is non increasing in ùë†, in general, this problem need not admit a continuous viscosity solution. Even in this case we obtain a formula for discontinuous viscosity solutions.

entry.keywords: Hamilton-Jacobi equation;dynamic programming principle;viscosity sub and super solutions.

entry.title: Completely Monotone Multisequences, Symmetric Probabilities and a Normal Limit Theorem

abstract.p: Let $G_{n,k}$ be the set of all partial completely monotone multisequences of order ùëõ and degree ùëò, i.e., multisequences $c_n(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k), \beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k = 0, 1, 2,\ldots ,\beta_1 + \beta_2+\cdots +\beta_k\leq n, c_n(0,0,\ldots ,0) = 1$ and $(-1)^{\beta_0}\Delta^{\beta_0} c_n(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)\geq 0$ whenever $\beta_0\leq n-(\beta_1 + \beta_2+\cdots +\beta_k)$ where $\Delta_{c_n}(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)=c_n(\beta_1+1,\beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)+c_n(\beta_1,\beta_2+1,\ldots ,\beta_k)+\cdots +c_n(\beta_1,\beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k+1)-c_n(\beta_1,\beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)$. Further, let $\prod_{n,k}$ be the set of all symmetric probabilities on $\{0, 1, 2,\ldots ,k\}^n$. We establish a one-to-one correspondence between the sets $G_{n, k}$ and $\prod_{n, k}$ and use it to formulate and answer interesting questions about both. Assigning to $G_{n, k}$ the uniform probability measure, we show that, as $n\to\infty$, any fixed section $\{c_n(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k), 1\leq \sum\beta_i\leq m\}$, properly centered and normalized, is asymptotically multivariate normal. That is, $\left\{\sqrt{\left(\binom{n+k}{k}\right)}(c_n(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)-c_0(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k), 1\leq \beta_1+\beta_2+\cdots +\beta_k\leq m\right\}$ converges weakly to MVN$[0,\Sigma_m]$; the centering constants $c_0(\beta_1, \beta_2,\ldots ,\beta_k)$ and the asymptotic covariances depend on the moments of the Dirichlet $(1, 1,\ldots ,1; 1)$ distribution on the standard simplex in $R^k$.

author.name: J. C. Gupta
author.affiliation: Indian Statistical Institute, 7, SJS Sansanwal Marg, New Delhi 110 016, India Corresponding Address: 32, Mirdha Tola, Budaun 243 601, India

entry.title: An Asymptotic Derivation of Weakly Nonlinear Ray Theory

abstract.p: Using a method of expansion similar to Chapman‚ÄìEnskog expansion, a new formal perturbation scheme based on high frequency approximation has been constructed. The scheme leads to an eikonal equation in which the leading order amplitude appears. The transport equation for the amplitude has been deduced with an error $O(\epsilon^2)$ where ùúñ is the small parameter appearing in the high frequency approximation. On a length scale over which Choquet‚ÄìBruhat's theory is valid, this theory reduces to the former. The theory is valid on a much larger length scale and the leading order terms give the weakly nonlinear ray theory (WNLRT) of Prasad, which has been very successful in giving physically realistic results and also in showing that the caustic of a linear theory is resolved when nonlinear effects are included. The weak shock ray theory with infinite system of compatibility conditions also follows from this theory.

author.name: Phoolan Prasad
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Indian Institute of Science, Bangalore 560 012, India

entry.title: Steady-State Response of a Micropolar Generalized Thermoelastic Half-Space to the Moving Mechanical/Thermal Loads

abstract.p: Microrotation effect of a load applied normal to the boundary and moving at a constant velocity along one of the co-ordinate axis in a generalized thermoelastic half-space is studied. The analytical expressions of the displacement component, force stress, couple stress and temperature field for two different theories i.e. Lord-Shulman (L-S) and Green-Lindsay (G-L) for supersonic, subsonic and transonic velocities in case of mechanical and thermal sources applied, are obtained by the use of Fourier transform technique. The integral transforms have been inverted by using a numerical technique and the numerical results are illustrated graphically for magnesium crystal-like material.

Algebraic Stacks

entry.title: Variational Formulae for Fuchsian Groups over Families of Algebraic Curves

abstract.p: We study the problem of understanding the uniformizing Fuchsian groups for a family of plane algebraic curves by determining explicit first variational formulae for the generators.

entry.title: Limits of Commutative Triangular Systems on Locally Compact Groups

abstract.p:
On a locally compact group ùê∫, if $
u_n^{k_n}	o\mu, (k_n	o\infty)$, for some probability measures $
u_n$ and ùúá on ùê∫, then a sufficient condition is obtained for the set $A = \{
u_n^m|m\leq k_n\}$ to be relatively compact; this in turn implies the embeddability of a shift of ùúá. The condition turns out to be also necessary when ùê∫ is totally disconnected. In particular, it is shown that if ùê∫ is a discrete linear group over $\mathsf{R}$ then a shift of the limit ùúá is embeddable. It is also shown that any infinitesimally divisible measure on a connected nilpotent real algebraic group is embeddable.

author.name: Riddhi Shah
author.affiliation: School of Mathematics, Tata Institute of Fundamental Research, Homi Bhabha Road, Mumbai 400 005, India

entry.title: Topological ∗-algebras with $C^\ast$-enveloping Algebras II

abstract.p: Universal $C^\ast$-algebras $C^\ast(A)$ exist for certain topological ∗-algebras called algebras with a $C^\ast$-enveloping algebra. A Frechet ∗-algebra ùê¥ has a $C^\ast$-enveloping algebra if and only if every operator representation of ùê¥ maps ùê¥ into bounded operators. This is proved by showing that every unbounded operator representation ùúã, continuous in the uniform topology, of a topological ∗-algebra ùê¥, which is an inverse limit of Banach ∗-algebras, is a direct sum of bounded operator representations, thereby factoring through the enveloping pro-$C^\ast$ algebra $E(A)$ of ùê¥. Given a $C^\ast$-dynamical system $(G, A, \alpha)$, any topological ∗-algebra ùêµ containing $C_c(G, A)$ as a dense ∗-subalgebra and contained in the crossed product $C^\ast$-algebra $C^\ast(G, A, \alpha)$ satisfies $E(B)=C^\ast(G, A, \alpha)$. If $G = \mathbb{R}$, if ùêµ is an ùõº-invariant dense Frechet ∗-subalgebra of ùê¥ such that $E(B) = A$, and if the action ùõº on ùêµ is ùëö-tempered, smooth and by continuous ∗-automorphisms: then the smooth Schwartz crossed product $S(\mathbb{R}, B, \alpha)$ satisfies $E(S(\mathbb{R}, B, \alpha)) = C^\ast(\mathbb{R}, A, \alpha)$. When ùê∫ is a Lie group, the $C^{\infty}$-elements $C^{\infty}(A)$, the analytic elements $C^{\omega}(A)$ as well as the entire analytic elements $C^{\ell\omega}(A)$ carry natural topologies making them algebras with a $C^\ast$-enveloping algebra. Given a non-unital $C^\ast$-algebra ùê¥, an inductive system of ideals $I_\alpha$ is constructed satisfying $A = C^\ast-\mathrm{ind} \lim I_\alpha$; and the locally convex inductive limit $\mathrm{ind}\lim I_\alpha$ is an ùëö-convex algebra with the $C^\ast$-enveloping algebra ùê¥ and containing the Pedersen ideal $K_A$ of ùê¥. Given generators ùê∫ with weakly Banach admissible relations ùëÖ, we construct universal topological ∗-algebra $A(G, R)$ and show that it has a $C^\ast$-enveloping algebra if and only if $(G, R)$ is $C^\ast$-admissible.

entry.keywords: Frechet ∗-algebra;topological ∗-algebra;$C^\ast$-enveloping algebra;unbounded operator representation;$O^\ast$-algebra;smooth Frechet algebra crossed product;Pedersen ideal of a $C^\ast$-algebra;groupoid $C^\ast$-algebra;universal algebra on generators with relations.

entry.title: Periodic and Boundary Value Problems for Second Order Differential Equations

abstract.p: In this paper we study second order scalar differential equations with Sturm‚ÄìLiouville and periodic boundary conditions. The vector field $f(t, x, y)$ is Caratheodory and in some instances the continuity condition on ùë• or ùë¶ is replaced by a monotonicity type hypothesis. Using the method of upper and lower solutions as well as truncation and penalization techniques, we show the existence of solutions and extremal solutions in the order interval determined by the upper and lower solutions. Also we establish some properties of the solutions and of the set they form.

entry.title: Steady-state Response of a Micropolar Generalized Thermoelastic Half-space to the Moving Mechanical/Thermal Loads
Descent Principle in Modular Galois Theory

abstract.p: We propound a descent principle by which previously constructed equations over GF$(q^n)(X)$ may be deformed to have incarnations over GF$(q)(X)$ without changing their Galois groups. Currently this is achieved by starting with a vectorial (= additive) ùëû-polynomial of ùëû-degree ùëö with Galois group GL$(m, q)$ and then, under suitable conditions, enlarging its Galois group to GL$(m, q^n)$ by forming its generalized iterate relative to an auxiliary irreducible polynomial of degree ùëõ. Elsewhere this was proved under certain conditions by using the classification of finite simple groups, and under some other conditions by using Kantor's classification of linear groups containing a Singer cycle. Now under different conditions we prove it by using Cameron-Kantor's classification of two-transitive linear groups.

abstract.p: Let ùëã be an integral projective curve and $L\in \mathrm{Pic}^a(X), M \in \mathrm{Pic}^b(X)$ with $h^1(X, L) = h^1(X, M) = 0$ and $L, M$ general. entry.title: Spectra of Anderson Type Models with Decaying Randomness

abstract.p: In this paper we consider some Anderson type models, with free parts having long range tails with the random perturbations decaying at different rates in different directions and prove that there is a.c. spectrum in the model which is pure. In addition, we show that there is pure point spectrum outside some interval. Our models include potentials decaying in all directions in which case absence of singular continuous spectrum is also shown.

entry.title: On Totally Reducible Binary Forms: I

abstract.p: Let $\upsilon(n)$ be the number of positive numbers up to a large limit ùëõ that are expressible in essentially more than one way by a binary form ùëì that is a product of $l > 2$ distinct linear factors with integral coefficients. We prove that
$$\upsilon(n) = O\left(n^{2/l-\eta_l+\epsilon}\right),$$
where
\begin{equation*}\eta_l=\begin{cases}1/l^2, \quad\text{if}\quad l=3,\\ (l-2)/l^2(l-1), \quad\text{if}\quad l>3,\end{cases}\end{equation*}
thus demonstrating in particular that it is exceptional for a number represented by ùëì to have essentially more than one representation.

entry.title: Principal ùê∫-bundles on Nodal Curves

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a connected semisimple affine algebraic group defined over ùê∂. We study the relation between stable, semistable ùê∫-bundles on a nodal curve ùëå and representations of the fundamental group of ùëå. This study is done by extending the notion of (generalized) parabolic vector bundles to principal ùê∫-bundles on the desingularization ùê∂ of ùëå and using the correspondence between them and principal ùê∫-bundles on ùëå. We give an isomorphism of the stack of generalized parabolic bundles on ùê∂ with a quotient stack associated to loop groups. We show that if ùê∫ is simple and simply connected then the Picard group of the stack of principal ùê∫-bundles on ùëå is isomorphic to $\oplus_m Z, m$ being the number of components of ùëå.

entry.title: On Property (ùõΩ) in Banach Lattices, Calder√≥n‚ÄìLozanowskiiÃÜ and Orlicz‚ÄìLorentz Spaces

abstract.p: The geometry of Calder√≥n‚ÄìLozanowskiiÃÜ spaces, which are strongly connected with the interpolation theory, was essentially developing during the last few years (see [4, 9, 10, 12, 13, 17]). On the other hand many authors investigated property (ùõΩ) in Banach spaces (see [7, 19, 20, 21, 25, 26]). The first aim of this paper is to study property (ùõΩ) in Banach function lattices. Namely a criterion for property (ùõΩ) in Banach function lattice is presented. In particular we get that in Banach function lattice property (ùõΩ) implies uniform monotonicity. Moreover, property (ùõΩ) in generalized Calder√≥n‚ÄìLozanowskiiÃÜ function spaces is studied. Finally, it is shown that in Orlicz‚ÄìLorentz function spaces property (ùõΩ) and uniform convexity coincide.

entry.title: On Oscillation and Asymptotic Behaviour of Solutions of Forced First Order Neutral Differential Equations

abstract.p: In this paper, sufficient conditions have been obtained under which every solution of
$[y(t)\pm y(t-\tau)]'\pm\mathcal{Q}(t)G(y(t-\sigma)) = f(t),\quad t\geq 0$,
oscillates or tends to zero or to $\pm\infty$ as $t\to\infty$. Usually these conditions are stronger than
\begin{equation*}\int\limits_0^\infty\mathcal{Q}(t)dt=\infty.\tag{*}\end{equation*}
An example is given to show that the condition $(\ast)$ is not enough to arrive at the above conclusion. Existence of a positive (or negative) solution of
$[y(t)-y(t-\tau)]'+\mathcal{Q}(t)G(y(t-\sigma))=f(t)$
is considered.

entry.title: On Initial Conditions for a Boundary Stabilized Hybrid Euler‚ÄìBernoulli Beam

abstract.p: We consider here small flexural vibrations of an Euler‚ÄìBernoulli beam with a lumped mass at one end subject to viscous damping force while the other end is free and the system is set to motion with initial displacement $y^0(x)$ and initial velocity $y^1(x)$. By investigating the evolution of the motion by Laplace transform, it is proved (in dimensionless units of length and time) that
$$\int_0^1 y_{xt}^2 dx \leq \int_0^1 y_{xx}^2 dx, \quad t>t_0,$$

where $t_0$ may be sufficiently large, provided that $\{y^0, y^1\}$ satisfy very general restrictions stated in the concluding theorem. This supplies the restrictions for uniform exponential energy decay for stabilization of the beam considered in a recent paper.

entry.keywords: Euler‚ÄìBernoulli beam equation;hybrid system;initial conditions;small deflection;exponential energy decay.

entry.title: Cyclic Codes of Length $2^m$

abstract.p: In this paper explicit expressions of $m + 1$ idempotents in the ring $R = F_q[X]/\langle X^{2^m}-1\rangle$ are given. Cyclic codes of length $2^m$ over the finite field $F_q$, of odd characteristic, are defined in terms of their generator polynomials. The exact minimum distance and the dimension of the codes are obtained.

entry.title: Unitary Tridiagonalization in $M(4, \mathbb{C})$

abstract.p: A question of interest in linear algebra is whether all $n \times n$ complex matrices can be unitarily tridiagonalized. The answer for all $n\neq 4$ (affirmative or negative) has been known for a while, whereas the case $n = 4$ seems to have remained open. In this paper we settle the $n = 4$ case in the affirmative. Some machinery from complex algebraic geometry needs to be used.

entry.title: On Ricci Curvature of ùê∂-totally Real Submanifolds in Sasakian Space Forms

abstract.p: Let $M^n$ be a Riemannian ùëõ-manifold. Denote by $S(p)$ and $\overline{Ric}(p)$ the Ricci tensor and the maximum Ricci curvature on $M^n$, respectively. In this paper we prove that every ùê∂-totally real submanifold of a Sasakian space form $\overline{M}^{2m + 1}(c)$ satisfies $S\leq \left(\frac{(n - 1)(c + 3)}{4} + \frac{n^2}{4}H^2\right)g$, where $H^2$ and ùëî are the square mean curvature function and metric tensor on $M^n$, respectively. The equality holds identically if and only if either $M^n$ is totally geodesic submanifold or $n = 2$ and $M^n$ is totally umbilical submanifold. Also we show that if a ùê∂-totally real submanifold $M^n$ of $\overline{M}^{2n + 1}(c)$ satisfies $\overline{Ric}=\frac{(n-1)(c+3)}{4} + \frac{n^2}{4}H^2$ identically, then it is minimal.

entry.title: A variational Proof for the Existence of a Conformal Metric with Preassigned Negative Gaussian Curvature for Compact Riemann Surfaces of Genus $\gt 1$

abstract.p: Given a smooth function $K < 0$ we prove a result by Berger, Kazhdan and others that in every conformal class there exists a metric which attains this function as its Gaussian curvature for a compact Riemann surface of genus $g\gt 1$. We do so by minimizing an appropriate functional using elementary analysis. In particular for ùêæ a negative constant, this provides an elementary proof of the uniformization theorem for compact Riemann surfaces of genus $g\gt 1$.

entry.title: Multiwavelet Packets and Frame Packets of $L^2(\mathbb{R}^d)$

abstract.p: The orthonormal basis generated by a wavelet of $L^2(\mathbb{R})$ has poor frequency localization. To overcome this disadvantage Coifman, Meyer, and Wickerhauser constructed wavelet packets. We extend this concept to the higher dimensions where we consider arbitrary dilation matrices. The resulting basis of $L^2(\mathbb{R}^d)$ is called the multiwavelet packet basis. The concept of wavelet frame packet is also generalized to this setting. Further, we show how to construct various orthonormal bases of $L^2(\mathbb{R}^d)$ from the multiwavelet packets.

entry.title: Nonlinear Elliptic Differential Equations with Multivalued Nonlinearities

abstract.p: In this paper we study nonlinear elliptic boundary value problems with monotone and nonmonotone multivalued nonlinearities. First we consider the case of monotone nonlinearities. In the first result we assume that the multivalued nonlinearity is defined on all $\mathbb{R}$. Assuming the existence of an upper and of a lower solution, we prove the existence of a solution between them. Also for a special version of the problem, we prove the existence of extremal solutions in the order interval formed by the upper and lower solutions. Then we drop the requirement that the monotone nonlinearity is defined on all of $\mathbb{R}$. This case is important because it covers variational inequalities. Using the theory of operators of monotone type we show that the problem has a solution. Finally in the last part we consider an eigenvalue problem with a nonmonotone multivalued nonlinearity. Using the critical point theory for nonsmooth locally Lipschitz functionals we prove the existence of at least two nontrivial solutions (multiplicity theorem).

entry.keywords: Upper solution;lower solution;order interval;truncation function;pseudomonotone operator;coercive operator;extremal solution;Yosida approximation;nonsmooth Palais‚ÄìSmale condition;critical point;eigenvalue problem.

entry.title: The Universal Eigenvalue Bounds of Payne‚ÄìP√≥lya‚ÄìWeinberger, Hile‚ÄìProtter, and H C Yang

abstract.p: In this paper we present a unified and simplified approach to the universal eigenvalue inequalities of Payne‚ÄìP√≥lya‚ÄìWeinberger, Hile‚ÄìProtter, and Yang. We then generalize these results to inhomogeneous membranes and Schr√∂dinger's equation with a nonnegative potential. We also show that Yang's inequality is always better than Hile‚ÄìProtter's (and hence also better than Payne‚ÄìP√≥lya‚ÄìWeinberger's). In fact, Yang's weaker inequality (which deserves to be better known),
$$\lambda_{k+1} < \left(1+\frac{4}{n}\right)\frac{1}{k}\sum^k_{i=1} \lambda_i,$$
is also strictly better than Hile‚ÄìProtter's. Finally, we treat Yang's (and related) inequalities for minimal submanifolds of a sphere and domains contained in a sphere by our methods.

abstract.p: The integrated density of states (IDS) for random operators is an important function describing many physical characteristics of a random system. Properties of the IDS are derived from the Wegner estimate that describes the influence of finite-volume perturbations on a background system. In this paper, we present a simple proof of the Wegner estimate applicable to a wide variety of random perturbations of deterministic background operators. The proof yields the correct volume dependence of the upper bound. This implies the local H√∂lder continuity of the integrated density of states at energies in the unperturbed spectral gap. entry.title: Energy Transfer in Scattering by Rotating Potentials

abstract.p: Quantum mechanical scattering theory is studied for time-dependent Schr√∂dinger operators, in particular for particles in a rotating potential. Under various assumptions about the decay rate at infinity we show uniform boundedness in time for the kinetic energy of scattering states, existence and completeness of wave operators, and existence of a conserved quantity under scattering. In a simple model we determine the energy transferred to a particle by collision with a rotating blade.

entry.title: Magnetic Bottles for the Neumann Problem: The Case of Dimension 3

abstract.p: The main object of this paper is to analyze the recent results obtained on the Neumann realization of the Schr√∂dinger operator in the case of dimension 3 by Lu and Pan. After presenting a short treatment of their spectral analysis of key-models, we show briefly how to implement the techniques of Helffer‚ÄìMorame in order to give some localization of the ground state. This leaves open the question of the localization by curvature effect which was solved in the case of dimension 2 in our previous work and will be analysed in the case of dimension 3 in a future paper.

entry.title: The Extraordinary Spectral Properties of Radially Periodic Schr√∂dinger Operators

abstract.p: Since it became clear that the band structure of the spectrum of periodic Sturm Liouville operators $t = - (d^2/dr^2) + q(r)$ does not survive a spherically symmetric extension to Schr√∂dinger operators $T = - \Delta + V$ with $V(x) = q(|x|)$ for $x \in \mathbb{R}^d, d \in \mathbb{N}\backslash\{1\}$, a wealth of detailed information about the spectrum of such operators has been acquired. The observation of eigenvalues embedded in the essential spectrum $[\mu_0, \infty]$ of ùëá with exponentially decaying eigenfunctions provided evidence for the existence of intervals of dense point spectrum, eventually proved by spherical separation into perturbed Sturm‚ÄìLiouville operators $t_c = t + (c/r^2)$. Subsequently, a numerical approach was employed to investigate the distribution of eigenvalues of ùëá more closely. An eigenvalue was discovered below the essential spectrum in the case $d = 2$, and it turned out that there are in fact infinitely many, accumulating at $\mu_0$. Moreover, a method based on oscillation theory made it possible to count eigenvalues of $t_c$ contributing to an interval of dense point spectrum of ùëá. We gained evidence that an asymptotic formula, valid for $c \to \infty$, does in fact produce correct numbers even for small values of the coupling constant, such that a rather precise picture of the spectrum of radially periodic Schr√∂dinger operators has now been obtained.

entry.keywords: Schr√∂dinger operator;self-adjointness;embedded eigenvalue;exponential decay;dense point spectrum.

entry.title: On Perturbation of Eigenvalues Embedded at Thresholds in a Two Channel Model

abstract.p: We present some results on the perturbation of eigenvalues embedded at thresholds in a two channel model Hamiltonian with a small off-diagonal perturbation. Examples are given of the various types of behavior of the eigenvalue under perturbation.

entry.keywords: Schr√∂dinger operator;perturbation theory;threshold eigenvalue;two channel model.

entry.title: On Spectral Properties of Periodic Polyharmonic Matrix Operators

abstract.p: We consider a matrix operator $H = (-\Delta)^l + V$ in $R^n$, where $n \geq 2, l \geq 1, 4l > n + 1$, and ùëâ is the operator of multiplication by a periodic in ùë• matrix $V(x)$. We study spectral properties of ùêª in the high energy region. Asymptotic formulae for Bloch eigenvalues and the corresponding spectral projections are constructed. The Bethe‚ÄìSommerfeld conjecture, stating that the spectrum of ùêª can have only a finite number of gaps, is proved.

entry.keywords: Periodic Schr√∂dinger operator;Bloch eigenvalues and eigenfunctions;Bethe‚ÄìSommerfeld conjecture.

entry.title: Wegner Estimate for Sparse and other Generalized Alloy Type Potentials

abstract.p: We prove a Wegner estimate for generalized alloy type models at negative energies (Theorems 8 and 13). The single site potential is assumed to be non-positive. The random potential does not need to be stationary with respect to translations from a lattice. Actually, the set of points to which the individual single site potentials are attached, needs only to satisfy a certain density condition. The distribution of the coupling constants is assumed to have a bounded density only in the energy region where we prove the Wegner estimate.

entry.keywords: Wegner estimate;density of states;random Schr√∂dinger operators;non-stationary potentials;singular distribution of coupling constants.

entry.title: Lifshitz Tails for Random Perturbations of Periodic Schr√∂dinger Operators

abstract.p: The present paper is a non-exhaustive review of Lifshitz tails for random perturbations of periodic Schr√∂dinger operators. It is not our goal to review the whole literature on Lifshitz tails; we will concentrate on a single model, the continuous Anderson model.

entry.keywords: Random Schr√∂dinger operators;density of states;Lifshitz tails.

entry.title: Smoothness of Density of States for Random Decaying Interaction

abstract.p: In this paper we consider one dimensional random Jacobi operators with decaying independent randomness and show that under some condition on the decay vis-a-vis the distribution of randomness, that the distribution function of the average spectral measures of the associated operators are smooth.

abstract.p: In this note, we consider the Lifshitz singularity for Schr√∂dinger operator with ergodic random magnetic field. A key estimate is an energy bound for magnetic Schr√∂dinger operators as discussed in Nakamura [8]. Here we remove a technical assumption in [8], namely, the uniform boundedness of the magnetic field.

abstract.p: In this short paper, the usage of truncation method to get information about essential spectrum of bounded as well as semi-bounded linear operators on separable Hilbert spaces, is investigated. In addition to this, the problem of predicting the gaps in the essential spectrum of self-adjoint operators, linear algebraically is also considered.

entry.title: Homogenization of a Parabolic Equation in Perforated Domain with Neumann Boundary Condition

abstract.p: In this article, we study the homogenization of the family of parabolic equations over periodically perforated domains

\begin{align*}\partial_tb\left(\frac{x}{\varepsilon}, u_{\varepsilon}\right)-\mathrm{div} a\left(\frac{x}{\varepsilon}, u_{\varepsilon},\nabla u_{\varepsilon}\right) & = f(x,t)\quad\text{in}\quad \Omega_{\varepsilon}\times(0, T),\\ a\left(\frac{x}{\varepsilon},u_{\varepsilon},\nabla u_{\varepsilon}\right).\upsilon_{\varepsilon} & = 0 \quad\text{on}\quad \partial S_{\varepsilon}\times(0, T),\\ u_{\varepsilon} & = 0 \quad\text{on}\quad \partial\Omega\times(0, T),\\ u_{\varepsilon}(x,0) & = u_0(x) \quad\text(in)\quad \Omega_{\varepsilon}.\end{align*}

Here, $\Omega_{\varepsilon} = \Omega \ S_{\varepsilon}$ is a periodically perforated domain. We obtain the homogenized equation and corrector results. The homogenization of the equations on a fixed domain was studied by the authors [15]. The homogenization for a fixed domain and $b\left(\frac{x}{\varepsilon},u_{\varepsilon}\right)\equiv b(u_{\varepsilon})$ has been done by Jian [11].

entry.title: Asymptotic Absolute Continuity for Perturbed Time-Dependent Quadratic Hamiltonians

abstract.p: We study the notion of asymptotic velocity for a class of perturbed time-dependent quadratic Hamiltonians. In particular we give a sufficient condition for absolute continuity.

entry.title: Strategies in Localization Proofs for One-Dimensional Random Schr√∂dinger Operators

abstract.p: Recent results on localization, both exponential and dynamical, for various models of one-dimensional, continuum, random Schr√∂dinger operators are reviewed. This includes Anderson models with indefinite single site potentials, the Bernoulli‚ÄìAnderson model, the Poisson model, and the random displacement model. Among the tools which are used to analyse these models are generalized spectral averaging techniques and results from inverse spectral and scattering theory. A discussion of open problems is included.

entry.title: High Energy Asymptotics of the Scattering Amplitude for the Schr√∂dinger Equation

abstract.p: We find an explicit function approximating at high energies the kernel of the scattering matrix with arbitrary accuracy. Moreover, the same function gives all diagonal singularities of the kernel of the scattering matrix in the angular variables.

author.name: D. Yafaev
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University Rennes-1, Campus Beaulieu, 35042 Rennes, France

entry.title: Two-Dimensional Weak Pseudomanifolds on Eight Vertices

abstract.p: We explicitly determine all the two-dimensional weak pseudomanifolds on 8 vertices. We prove that there are (up to isomorphism) exactly 95 such weak pseudomanifolds, 44 of which are combinatorial 2-manifolds. These 95 weak pseudomanifolds triangulate 16 topological spaces. As a consequence, we prove that there are exactly three 8-vertex two-dimensional orientable pseudomanifolds which allow degree three maps to the 4-vertex 2-sphere.

entry.title: Sums of Two Polynomials with Each having Real Zeros Symmetric with the Other

abstract.p: Consider the polynomial equation

where $0 < r_1 \leq r_2 \leq \cdots \leq r_n$. All zeros of this equation lie on the imaginary axis. In this paper, we show that no two of the zeros can be equal and the gaps between the zeros in the upper half-plane strictly increase as one proceeds upward. Also we give some examples of geometric progressions of the zeros in the upper half-plane in cases $n = 6, 8, 10$.

entry.title: The Heat Kernel and Hardy's Theorem on Symmetric Spaces of Noncompact Type

abstract.p: For symmetric spaces of noncompact type we prove an analogue of Hardy's theorem which characterizes the heat kernel in terms of its order of magnitude and that of its Fourier transform.

abstract.p: A new formulation for the limit matrix occurring in the cost functional of an optimal control problem on homogenization is obtained. It is used to obtain an upper bound for this matrix (in the sense of positive definite matrices).

entry.title: Reflected Backward Stochastic Differential Equations in an Orthant

abstract.p: We consider RBSDE in an orthan with oblique reflection and with time and space dependent coefficients, viz.
$$Z(t)=\xi +\int_t^T b(s, Z(s))ds + \int_t^T R(s, Z(s))dY(s)-\int_t^T\langle U(s), dB(s)\rangle$$

with $Z_i(\cdot p)\geq 0, Y_i(\cdot p)$ nondecreasing and $Y_i(\cdot p)$ increasing only when $Z_i(\cdot p) = 0, 1 \leq i \leq d$. Existence of a unique solution is established under Lipschitz continuity of $b, R$ and a uniform spectral radius condition on ùëÖ. On the way we also prove a result concerning the variational distance between the `pushing parts' of solutions of auxiliary one-dimensional problem.

entry.title: Stability of a Bubble Expanding and Translating Through an Inviscid Liquid

abstract.p: A bubble expands adiabatically and translates in an incompressible and inviscid liquid. We investigate the number of equilibrium points of the bubble and the nature of stability of the bubble at these points. We find that there is only one equilibrium point and the bubble is stable there.

entry.title: The Determinant Bundle on the Moduli Space of Stable Triples over a Curve

abstract.p: We construct a holomorphic Hermitian line bundle over the moduli space of stable triples of the form $(E_1, E_2, \phi)$, where $E_1$ and $E_2$ are holomorphic vector bundles over a fixed compact Riemann surface ùëã, and $\phi : E_2 \to E_1$ is a holomorphic vector bundle homomorphism. The curvature of the Chern connection of this holomorphic Hermitian line bundle is computed. The curvature is shown to coincide with a constant scalar multiple of the natural K√§hler form on the moduli space. The construction is based on a result of Quillen on the determinant line bundle over the space of Dolbeault operators on a fixed $C^{\infty}$ Hermitian vector bundle over a compact Riemann surface.

entry.title: A Geometric Characterization of Arithmetic Varieties

abstract.p: A result of Belyi can be stated as follows. Every curve defined over a number field can be expressed as a cover of the projective line with branch locus contained in a rigid divisor. We define the notion of geometrically rigid divisors in surfaces and then show that every surface defined over a number field can be expressed as a cover of the projective plane with branch locus contained in a geometrically rigid divisor in the plane. The main result is the characterization of arithmetically defined divisors in the plane as geometrically rigid divisors in the plane.

abstract.p: We classify principal ùê∫-bundles on the projective line over an arbitrary field ùëò of characteristic $\neq 2$ or 3, where ùê∫ is a reductive group. If such a bundle is trivial at a ùëò-rational point, then the structure group can be reduced to a maximal torus.

entry.title: Gao's Conjecture on Zero-Sum Sequences

abstract.p: In this paper, we shall address three closely-related conjectures due to van Emde Boas, W D Gao and Kemnitz on zero-sum problems on $\mathbf{Z}_p \oplus \mathbf{Z}_p$. We prove a number of results including a proof of the conjecture of Gao for the prime $p = 7$ (Theorem 3.1). The conjecture of Kemnitz is also proved (Propositions 4.6, 4.9, 4.10) for many classes of sequences.

entry.title: A Basic Inequality for Submanifolds in Locally Conformal almost Cosymplectic Manifolds

abstract.p: For submanifolds tangent to the structure vector field in locally conformal almost cosymplectic manifolds of pointwise constant ùúë-sectional curvature, we establish a basic inequality between the main intrinsic invariants of the submanifold on one side, namely its sectional curvature and its scalar curvature; and its main extrinsic invariant on the other side, namely its squared mean curvature. Some applications including inequalities between the intrinsic invariant $\delta_M$ and the squared mean curvature are given. The equality cases are also discussed.

entry.title: Homogenization of a Parabolic Equation in Perforated Domain with Dirichlet Boundary Condition

abstract.p: In this article, we study the homogenization of the family of parabolic equations over periodically perforated domains

\begin{align*}\partial_t b\left(\frac{x}{d_{\varepsilon}},u_{\varepsilon}\right)-\mathrm{div} a(u_{\varepsilon},\nabla u_{\varepsilon}) & = f(x,t)\quad\text{in}\quad\Omega_{\varepsilon}\times(0,T),\\ u_{\varepsilon} & = 0\quad\text{on}\quad\partial\Omega_{\varepsilon}\times(0,T),\\ u_{\varepsilon}(x,0) & = u_0(x)\quad\text{in}\quad\Omega_{\varepsilon}.\end{align*}

Here, $\Omega_{\varepsilon} = \Omega \backslash S_{\varepsilon}$ is a periodically perforated domain and $d_{\varepsilon}$ is a sequence of positive numbers which goes to zero. We obtain the homogenized equation. The homogenization of the equations on a fixed domain and also the case of perforated domain with Neumann boundary condition was studied by the authors. The homogenization for a fixed domain and $b(\frac{x}{d_{\varepsilon}}, u_{\varepsilon}) \equiv b(u_{\varepsilon})$ has been done by Jian. We also obtain certain corrector results to improve the weak convergence.

abstract.p: Let ùëì be a non-decreasing $C^1$-function such that $f > 0$ on $(0, \infty), f(0) = 0, \int_1^\infty 1/\sqrt{F(t)}dt < \infty$ and $F(t)/f^{2/a}(t)\to 0$ as $t \to\infty$, where $F(t) = \int_0^t f(s)ds$ and $a \in (0,2]$. We prove the existence of positive large solutions to the equation $\Delta u + q(x)|\nabla u|^a = p(x) f(u)$ in a smooth bounded domain $\Omega\subset R^N$, provided that $p, q$ are non-negative continuous functions so that any zero of ùëù is surrounded by a surface strictly included in ùõ∫ on which ùëù is positive. Under additional hypotheses on ùëù we deduce the existence of solutions if ùõ∫ is unbounded.

entry.title: Stokes Flow with Slip and Kuwabara Boundary Conditions

abstract.p: The forces experienced by randomly and homogeneously distributed parallel circular cylinder or spheres in uniform viscous flow are investigated with slip boundary condition under Stokes approximation using particle-in-cell model technique and the result compared with the no-slip case. The corresponding problem of streaming flow past spheroidal particles departing but little in shape from a sphere is also investigated. The explicit expression for the stream function is obtained to the first order in the small parameter characterizing the deformation. As a particular case of this we considered an oblate spheroid and evaluate the drag on it.

entry.title: Limits of Rank 4 Azumaya Algebras and Applications to Desingularization

abstract.p: It is shown that the schematic image of the scheme of Azumaya algebra structures on a vector bundle of rank 4 over any base scheme is separated, of finite type, smooth of relative dimension 13 and geometrically irreducible over that base and that this construction base-changes well. This fully generalizes Seshadri's theorem in [16] that the variety of specializations of $(2 \times 2)$-matrix algebras is smooth in characteristic $\neq 2$. As an application, a construction of Seshadri in [16] is shown in a characteristic-free way to desingularize the moduli space of rank 2 even degree semi-stable vector bundles on a complete curve. As another application, a construction of Nori over $\mathbb{Z}$ (Appendix, [16]) is extended to the case of a normal domain which is a universally Japanese (Nagata) ring and is shown to desingularize the Artin moduli space [1] of invariants of several matrices in rank 2. This desingularization is shown to have a good specialization property if the Artin moduli space has geometrically reduced fibers ‚Äì for example this happens over $\mathbb{Z}$. Essential use is made of Kneser's concept [8] of `semi-regular quadratic module'. For any free quadratic module of odd rank, a formula linking the half-discriminant and the values of the quadratic form on its radical is derived.

entry.keywords: Azumaya algebra;Clifford algebra;desingularization, moduli space;semi-regular quadratic form;simple module;vector bundle.

entry.title: Certain Fractional Derivative Formulae Involving the Product of a General Class of Polynomials and the Multivariable ùêª-Function

abstract.p: In the present paper, we obtain three unified fractional derivative formulae (FDF). The first involves the product of a general class of polynomials and the multivariable ùêª-function. The second involves the product of a general class of polynomials and two multivariable ùêª-functions and has been obtained with the help of the generalized Leibniz rule for fractional derivatives. The last FDF also involves the product of a general class of polynomials and the multivariable ùêª-function but it is obtained by the application of the first FDF twice and it involves two independent variables instead of one. The polynomials and the functions involved in all our fractional derivative formulae as well as their arguments which are of the type $x^\rho\prod_{i = 1}^s(x^{t_i} + \alpha_i)^{\sigma_i}$ are quite general in nature. These formulae, besides being of very general character have been put in a compact form avoiding the occurrence of infinite series and thus making them useful in applications. Our findings provide interesting unifications and extensions of a number of (new and known) results. For the sake of illustration, we give here exact references to the results (in essence) of five research papers [2, 3, 10, 12, 13] that follow as particular cases of our findings. In the end, we record a new fractional derivative formula involving the product of the Hermite polynomials, the Laguerre polynomials and the product of ùëü different Whittaker functions as a simple special case of our first formula.

entry.keywords: Riemann‚ÄìLiouville and Erd√©lyi‚ÄìKober fractional operators;fractional derivative formulae;general class of polynomials;multivariable ùêª-function;generalized Leibniz rule.

entry.title: A Complete Analogue of Hardy's Theorem on $SL_2 (\mathbb{R})$ and Characterization of the Heat Kernel

abstract.p: A theorem of Hardy characterizes the Gauss kernel (heat kernel of the Laplacian) on $\mathbb{R}$ from estimates on the function and its Fourier transform. In this article we establish a full group version of the theorem for $SL_2(\mathbb{R})$ which can accommodate functions with arbitrary ùêæ-types. We also consider the `heat equation' of the Casimir operator, which plays the role of the Laplacian for the group. We show that despite the structural difference of the Casimir with the Laplacian on $\mathbb{R}^n$ or the Laplace-Beltrami operator on the Riemannian symmetric spaces, it is possible to have a heat kernel. This heat kernel for the full group can also be characterized by Hardy-like estimates.

entry.title: Convexity of Spheres in a Manifold without Conjugate Points

abstract.p: For a non-compact, complete and simply connected manifold ùëÄ without conjugate points, we prove that if the determinant of the second fundamental form of the geodesic spheres in ùëÄ is a radial function, then the geodesic spheres are convex. We also show that if ùëÄ is two or three dimensional and without conjugate points, then, at every point there exists a ray with no focal points on it relative to the initial point of the ray. The proofs use a result from the theory of vector bundles combined with the index lemma.

entry.title: Stability Estimates for $h-p$ Spectral Element Methods for Elliptic Problems

abstract.p: In a series of papers of which this is the first we study how to solve elliptic problems on polygonal domains using spectral methods on parallel computers. To overcome the singularities that arise in a neighborhood of the corners we use a geometrical mesh. With this mesh we seek a solution which minimizes a weighted squared norm of the residuals in the partial differential equation and a fractional Sobolev norm of the residuals in the boundary conditions and enforce continuity by adding a term which measures the jump in the function and its derivatives at inter-element boundaries, in an appropriate fractional Sobolev norm, to the functional being minimized. Since the second derivatives of the actual solution are not square integrable in a neighborhood of the corners we have to multiply the residuals in the partial differential equation by an appropriate power of $r_k$, where $r_k$ measures the distance between the point ùëÉ and the vertex $A_k$ in a sectoral neighborhood of each of these vertices. In each of these sectoral neighborhoods we use a local coordinate system $(\tau_k, \theta_k)$ where $\tau_k = ln r_k$ and $(r_k, \theta_k)$ are polar coordinates with origin at $A_k$, as first proposed by Kondratiev. We then derive differentiability estimates with respect to these new variables and a stability estimate for the functional we minimize.

In [6] we will show that we can use the stability estimate to obtain parallel preconditioners and error estimates for the solution of the minimization problem which are nearly optimal as the condition number of the preconditioned system is polylogarithmic in ùëÅ, the number of processors and the number of degrees of freedom in each variable on each element. Moreover if the data is analytic then the error is exponentially small in ùëÅ.

entry.keywords: Corner singularities;geometrical mesh;modified polar coordinates;quasi-uniform mesh;fractional Sobolev norms;stability estimate;polylogarithmic bounds.

entry.title: Slow Motion of a Sphere Away from a Wall: Effect of Surface Roughness on the Viscous Force

abstract.p: An asymptotic analysis is given for the effect of roughness exhibited through the slip parameter ùõΩ on the motion of the sphere, moving away from a plane surface with velocity ùëâ. The method replaces the no-slip condition at the rough surface by slip condition and employs the method of inner and outer regions on the sphere surface. For $\beta > 0$, we have the classical slip boundary condition and the results of the paper are then of interest in the microprocessor industry.

entry.title: Subject Index
Author Index
Preface
A Remark on the Unitary Group of a Tensor Product of ùëõ Finite-Dimensional Hilbert Spaces

abstract.p: Let $H_i, 1 \leq i \leq n$ be complex finite-dimensional Hilbert spaces of dimension $d_i, 1 \leq i \leq n$ respectively with $d_i \geq 2$ for every ùëñ. By using the method of quantum circuits in the theory of quantum computing as outlined in Nielsen and Chuang [2] and using a key lemma of Jaikumar [1] we show that every unitary operator on the tensor product $H = H_1 \otimes H_2 \otimes\ldots \otimes H_n$ can be expressed as a composition of a finite number of unitary operators living on pair products $H_i \otimes H_j, 1 \leq i, j \leq n$. An estimate of the number of operators appearing in such a composition is obtained.

entry.title: The Planar Algebra Associated to a Kac Algebra

abstract.p: We obtain (two equivalent) presentations ‚Äì in terms of generators and relations-of the planar algebra associated with the subfactor corresponding to (an outer action on a factor by) a finite-dimensional Kac algebra. One of the relations shows that the antipode of the Kac algebra agrees with the `rotation on 2-boxes'.

entry.title: Very Smooth Points of Spaces of Operators

abstract.p: In this paper we study very smooth points of Banach spaces with special emphasis on spaces of operators. We show that when the space of compact operators is an ùëÄ-ideal in the space of bounded operators, a very smooth operator ùëá attains its norm at a unique vector ùë• (up to a constant multiple) and $T(x)$ is a very smooth point of the range space. We show that if for every equivalent norm on a Banach space, the dual unit ball has a very smooth point then the space has the Radon‚ÄìNikod√Ωm property. We give an example of a smooth Banach space without any very smooth points.

entry.title: Order Units in a $C^\ast$-Algebra

abstract.p: Order unit property of a positive element in a $C^\ast$-algebra is defined. It is proved that precisely projections satisfy this order theoretic property. This way, unital hereditary $C^\ast$-subalgebras of a $C^\ast$-algebra are characterized.

entry.title: Some Approximation Theorems

abstract.p: The general theme of this note is illustrated by the following theorem:

Theorem 1. Suppose ùêæ is a compact set in the complex plane and 0 belongs to the boundary $\partial K$. Let $\mathcal{A}(K)$ denote the space of all functions ùëì on ùêæ such that ùëì is holomorphic in a neighborhood of ùêæ and $f(0) = 0$. Also for any given positive integer ùëö, let $\mathcal{A}(m, K)$ denote the space of all ùëì such that ùëì is holomorphic in a neighborhood of ùêæ and $f(0) = f'(0) = \cdots = f^{(m)}(0) = 0$. Then $\mathcal{A}(m, K)$ is dense in $\mathcal{A}(K)$ under the supremum norm on ùêæ provided that there exists a sector $W = \{re^{i\theta}; 0 \leq r \leq \delta, \alpha \leq \theta \leq \beta\}$ such that $W \cap K = \{0\}$. (This is the well-known Poincare's external cone condition).}
We present various generalizations of this result in the context of higher dimensions replacing holomorphic with harmonic.

entry.title: On the Local Artin Conductor $\mathfrak{f}$ Artin $(\chi)$ of a Character ùúí of Gal$(E/K)$ - II: Main Results for the Metabelian Case

abstract.p: This paper which is a continuation of [2], is essentially expository in nature, although some new results are presented. Let ùêæ be a local field with finite residue class field $k_K$. We first define (cf. Definition 2.4) the conductor $\mathfrak{f}(E/K)$ of an arbitrary finite Galois extension $E/K$ in the sense of non-abelian local class field theory as
$$\mathfrak{f}(E/K)=\mathfrak{p}_K^{[[n_G]]+1},$$

where $n_G$ is the break in the upper ramification filtration of $G = \mathrm{Gal}(E/K)$ defined by $G^{n_G} \neq G^{n_G+\delta} = 1, \forall\delta \in \mathbb{R}_{\gneq 0}$. Next, we study the basic properties of the ideal $\mathfrak{f}(E/K)$ in $O_K$ in case $E/K$ is a metabelian extension utilizing Koch‚Äìde Shalit metabelian local class field theory (cf. [8]).

After reviewing the Artin character $a_G:G \to \mathbb{C}$ of $G:=\mathrm{Gal}(E/K)$ and Artin representations $A_G:G \to GL(V)$ corresponding to $a_G:G \to \mathbb{C}$, we prove that (Proposition 3.2 and Corollary 3.5)
$$\mathfrak{f}\mathrm{Artin}(\chi_\rho)=\mathfrak{p}_K^{\dim_\mathbb{C}(V)[n_{G/\ker(\rho)}+1]},$$

where $\chi_\rho : G \to \mathbb{C}$ is the character associated to an irreducible representation $\rho : G \to GL(V)$ of $G (\text{over} \mathbb{C})$. The first main result (Theorem 1.2) of the paper states that, if in particular, $\rho : G \to GL(V)$ is an irreducible representation of $G (\text{over} \mathbb{C})$ with metabelian image, then
$$\mathfrak{f}\mathrm{Artin}(\chi_\rho)=\mathfrak{p}_K^{[E^{\ker(\rho)^\bullet}:K](n_{G/\ker(\rho)}+1)},$$

where $\mathrm{Gal}(E^{\ker(\rho)}/E^{\ker(\rho)^\bullet})$ is any maximal abelian normal subgroup of $\mathrm{Gal}(E^{\ker(\rho)}/K)$ containing $\mathrm{Gal}(E^{\ker(\rho)}/K)'$, and the break $n_{G/\ker(\rho)}$ in the upper ramification filtration of $G/\ker(\rho)$ can be computed and located by metabelian local class field theory. The proof utilizes Basmaji's theory on the structure of irreducible faithful representations of finite metabelian groups (cf. [1]) and on metabelian local class field theory (cf. [8]).

We then discuss the application of Theorem 1.2 on a problem posed by Weil on the construction of a `natural' $A_G$ of ùê∫ over $\mathbb{C}$ (Problem 1.3). More precisely, we prove in Theorem 1.4 that if $E/K$ is a metabelian extension with Galois group ùê∫, then

\begin{align*}A_G\simeq & \sum\limits_N[(E^N)^\bullet :K](n_{G/N}+1)\\ & \times\sum\limits_{[\omega]\sim\in\nu_N}\mathrm{Ind}_{\pi_N^{-1}((G/N)^\bullet)}^G\left(\omega\circ\pi_N|_{\pi_N^{-1}((G/N)^\bullet)}\right),\end{align*}

where ùëÅ runs over all normal subgroups of ùê∫, and for such an $N, \nu_N$ denotes the collection of all ‚àº-equivalence classes $[\omega]_\sim$, where `‚àº' denotes the equivalence relation on the set of all representations $\omega :(G/N)^\bullet\to\mathbb{C}^\times$ satisfying the conditions
$$\mathrm{Inert}(\omega)=\{\delta\in G/N :\omega_\delta=\omega\}=(G/N)^\bullet$$
and
$$\bigcap\limits_\delta \ker(\omega_\delta)=\langle 1_{G/N}\rangle,$$

where ùõø runs over $\mathcal{R}((G/N)^\bullet\backslash(G/N))$, a fixed given complete system of representatives of $(G/N)^\bullet\backslash(G/N)$, by declaring that $\omega_1 \sim \omega_2$ if and only if $\omega_1 = \omega_{2,\delta}$ for some $\delta \in \mathcal{R}((G/N)^\bullet\backslash(G/N))$.
Finally, we conclude our paper with certain remarks on Problem 1.1 and Problem 1.3.

entry.keywords: Local fields;higher-ramification groups;local Artin conductor;metabelian local class field theory;non-abelian local class field theory;local Langlands correspondence for $GL(n)$.

entry.title: The Jacobian of a Nonorientable Klein Surface

abstract.p: Using divisors, an analog of the Jacobian for a compact connected nonorientable Klein surface ùëå is constructed. The Jacobian is identified with the dual of the space of all harmonic real one-forms on ùëå quotiented by the torsion-free part of the first integral homology of ùëå. Denote by ùëã the double cover of ùëå given by orientation. The Jacobian of ùëå is identified with the space of all degree zero holomorphic line bundles ùêø over ùëã with the property that ùêø is isomorphic to $\sigma^\ast\overline{L}$, where ùúé is the involution of ùëã.

We show that every double coset in $G(F)\backslash G(A)/K$ has a representative in a maximal split torus of ùê∫. Here ùêæ is the set of integral ad√®lic points of ùê∫. entry.title: Wavelet Subspaces Invariant Under Groups of Translation Operators

abstract.p: We study the action of translation operators on wavelet subspaces. This action gives rise to an equivalence relation on the set of all wavelets. We show by explicit construction that each of the associated equivalence classes is non-empty.

entry.title: Beurling Algebra Analogues of the Classical Theorems of Wiener and L√©vy on Absolutely Convergent Fourier Series

abstract.p: Let ùëì be a continuous function on the unit circle ùõ§, whose Fourier series is ùúî-absolutely convergent for some weight ùúî on the set of integers $\mathcal{Z}$. If ùëì is nowhere vanishing on ùõ§, then there exists a weight ùúà on $\mathcal{Z}$ such that $1/f$ had ùúà-absolutely convergent Fourier series. This includes Wiener's classical theorem. As a corollary, it follows that if ùúë is holomorphic on a neighbourhood of the range of ùëì, then there exists a weight ùúí on $\mathcal{Z}$ such that $\varphi\circ f$ has ùúí-absolutely convergent Fourier series. This is a weighted analogue of L√©vy's generalization of Wiener's theorem. In the theorems, ùúà and ùúí are non-constant if and only if ùúî is non-constant. In general, the results fail if ùúà or ùúí is required to be the same weight ùúî.

entry.title: Analogues of Euler and Poisson Summation Formulae

abstract.p: Euler‚ÄìMaclaurin and Poisson analogues of the summations $\sum_{a < n \leq b}\chi(n)f(n), \sum_{a < n \leq b}d(n) f(n), \sum_{a < n \leq b}d(n)\chi(n) f(n)$ have been obtained in a unified manner, where $(\chi(n))$ is a periodic complex sequence; $d(n)$ is the divisor function and $f(x)$ is a sufficiently smooth function on $[a, b]$. entry.title: Subanalytic Bundles and Tubular Neighbourhoods of Zero-Loci

abstract.p: We introduce the natural and fairly general notion of a subanalytic bundle (with a finite dimensional vector space ùëÉ of sections) on a subanalytic subset ùëã of a real analytic manifold ùëÄ, and prove that when ùëÄ is compact, there is a Baire subset ùëà of sections in ùëÉ whose zero-loci in ùëã have tubular neighbourhoods, homeomorphic to the restriction of the given bundle to these zero-loci.

entry.keywords: Subanalytic set;subanalytic bundle;Strong Whitney stratification;Verdier stratification;tubular neighbourhood;zero-locus of subanalytic bundle;stratified transversality.

author.name: Vishwambhar Pati

entry.title: Equivalence of Quotient Hilbert Modules

abstract.p: Let $\mathcal{M}$ be a Hilbert module of holomorphic functions over a natural function algebra $\mathcal{A}(\Omega)$, where $\Omega \subseteq \mathbb{C}^m$ is a bounded domain. Let $\mathcal{M}_0 \subseteq \mathcal{M}$ be the submodule of functions vanishing to order ùëò on a hypersurface $\mathcal{Z} \subseteq \Omega$. We describe a method, which in principle may be used, to construct a set of complete unitary invariants for quotient modules $\mathcal{Q} = \mathcal{M} \ominus \mathcal{M}_0$. The invariants are given explicitly in the particular case of $k = 2$.

entry.keywords: Hilbert modules;function algebra;quotient module;longitudinal and transversal curvature;kernel function;jet and angle.

entry.title: Nonlinear Second-Order Multivalued Boundary Value Problems

abstract.p: In this paper we study nonlinear second-order differential inclusions involving the ordinary vector ùëù-Laplacian, a multivalued maximal monotone operator and nonlinear multivalued boundary conditions. Our framework is general and unifying and incorporates gradient systems, evolutionary variational inequalities and the classical boundary value problems, namely the Dirichlet, the Neumann and the periodic problems. Using notions and techniques from the nonlinear operatory theory and from multivalued analysis, we obtain solutions for both the `convex' and `nonconvex' problems. Finally, we present the cases of special interest, which fit into our framework, illustrating the generality of our results.

entry.keywords: Maximal monotone operator;pseudomonotone operator;Hartman condition;vector ùëù-Laplacian;convex and nonconvex problems;Leray‚ÄìSchauder alternative.

entry.title: Probabilistic Representations of Solutions to the Heat Equation

abstract.p: In this paper we provide a new (probabilistic) proof of a classical result in partial differential equations, viz. if ùúô is a tempered distribution, then the solution of the heat equation for the Laplacian, with initial condition ùúô, is given by the convolution of ùúô with the heat kernel (Gaussian density). Our results also extend the probabilistic representation of solutions of the heat equation to initial conditions that are arbitrary tempered distributions.

entry.keywords: Brownian motion;heat equation;translation operators;infinite dimensional stochastic differential equations.

entry.title: Vibrations of Thin Piezoelectric Shallow Shells: Two-Dimensional Approximation

abstract.p: In this paper we consider the eigenvalue problem for piezoelectric shallow shells and we show that, as the thickness of the shell goes to zero, the eigensolutions of the three-dimensional piezoelectric shells converge to the eigensolutions of a two-dimensional eigenvalue problem.

$L^1$-Convergence of Complex Double Fourier Series

abstract.p: It is proved that the complex double Fourier series of an integrable function $f(x, y)$ with coefficients $\{c_{jk}\}$ satisfying certain conditions, will converge in $L^1$-norm. The conditions used here are the combinations of Tauberian condition of Hardy‚ÄìKaramata kind and its limiting case. This paper extends the result of Bray [1] to complex double Fourier series.

entry.title: Pfister Involutions

abstract.p: The question of the existence of an analogue, in the framework of central simple algebras with involution, of the notion of Pfister form is raised. In particular, algebras with orthogonal involution which split as a tensor product of quaternion algebras with involution are studied. It is proven that, up to degree 16, over any extension over which the algebra splits, the involution is adjoint to a Pfister form. Moreover, cohomological invariants of those algebras with involution are discussed.

abstract.p: In this paper, we obtain the continuity for some multilinear operators related to certain non-convolution operators on the Triebel‚ÄìLizorkin space. The operators include Littlewood‚ÄìPaley operator and Marcinkiewicz operator.

entry.title: Stability Estimates for $h-p$ Spectral Element Methods for General Elliptic Problems on Curvilinear Domains

abstract.p: In this paper we show that the $h-p$ spectral element method developed in [3,8,9] applies to elliptic problems in curvilinear polygons with mixed Neumann and Dirichlet boundary conditions provided that the Babuska‚ÄìBrezzi inf-sup conditions are satisfied. We establish basic stability estimates for a non-conforming h-p spectral element method which allows for simultaneous mesh refinement and variable polynomial degree. The spectral element functions are non-conforming if the boundary conditions are Dirichlet. For problems with mixed boundary conditions they are continuous only at the vertices of the elements. We obtain a stability estimate when the spectral element functions vanish at the vertices of the elements, which is needed for parallelizing the numerical scheme. Finally, we indicate how the mesh refinement strategy and choice of polynomial degree depends on the regularity of the coefficients of the differential operator, smoothness of the sides of the polygon and the regularity of the data to obtain the maximum accuracy achievable.

entry.keywords: Corner singularities;geometrical mesh;mixed Neumann and Dirichlet boundary conditions;curvilinear polygons;inf‚Äìsup conditions;stability estimates;fractional Sobolev norms.

entry.title: A Probabilistic Approach to Second Order Variational Inequalities with Bilateral Constraints

abstract.p: We study a class of second order variational inequalities with bilateral constraints. Under certain conditions we show the existence of a unique viscosity solution of these variational inequalities and give a stochastic representation to this solution. As an application, we study a stochastic game with stopping times and show the existence of a saddle point equilibrium.

entry.keywords: Variational inequalities;viscosity solution;stochastic game;stopping time;value;saddle point equilibrium.

entry.title: Uniform Stability of Damped Nonlinear Vibrations of an Elastic String

abstract.p: Here we are concerned about uniform stability of damped nonlinear transverse vibrations of an elastic string fixed at its two ends. The vibrations governed by nonlinear integro-differential equation of Kirchoff type, is shown to possess energy uniformly bounded by exponentially decaying function of time. The result is achieved by considering an energy-like Lyapunov functional for the system.

entry.keywords: Uniform stability;Kirchoff type wave equation;Lyapunov functional;exponential energy decay.

entry.title: On Howard's Conjecture in Heterogeneous Shear Flow Problem

abstract.p: Howard's conjecture, which states that in the linear instability problem of inviscid heterogeneous parallel shear flow growth rate of an arbitrary unstable wave must approach zero as the wave length decreases to zero, is established in a mathematically rigorous fashion for plane parallel heterogeneous shear flows with negligible buoyancy force $g\beta \ll 1$ (Miles J W, J. Fluid Mech. 10 (1961) 496‚Äì508), where ùõΩ is the basic heterogeneity distribution function).
