entry.title: Representability of Hom Implies Flatness

abstract.p: Let ùëã be a projective scheme over a noetherian base scheme ùëÜ, and let $\mathcal{F}$ be a coherent sheaf on ùëã. For any coherent sheaf $\mathcal{E}$ on ùëã, consider the set-valued contravariant functor $\hom_{(\mathcal{E},\mathcal{F})}$ on ùëÜ-schemes, defined by $\hom_{(\mathcal{E},\mathcal{F})}(T)=\mathrm{Hom}(\mathcal{E}_T,\mathcal{F}_T)$ where $\mathcal{E}_T$ and $\mathcal{F}_T$ are the pull-backs of $\mathcal{E}$ and $\mathcal{F}$ to $X_T=X\times_s T$. A basic result of Grothendieck ([EGA], III 7.7.9) says that if $\mathcal{F}$ is flat over ùëÜ then $\hom_{(\mathcal{E},\mathcal{F})}$ is representable for all $\mathcal{E}$.

We prove the converse of the above, in fact, we show that if ùêø is a relatively ample line bundle on ùëã over ùëÜ such that the functor $\hom_{(L^{-n},\mathcal{F})}$ is representable for infinitely many positive integers ùëõ, then $\mathcal{F}$ is flat over ùëÜ. As a corollary, taking $X=S$, it follows that if $\mathcal{F}$ is a coherent sheaf on ùëÜ then the functor $T\mapsto H^0(T,\mathcal{F}_T)$ on the category of ùëÜ-schemes is representable if and only if $\mathcal{F}$ is locally free on ùëÜ. This answers a question posed by Angelo Vistoli.

The techniques we use involve the proof of flattening stratification, together with the methods used in proving the author's earlier result (see [N1]) that the automorphism group functor of a coherent sheaf on ùëÜ is representable if and only if the sheaf is locally free.

abstract.p: Let $X(\Delta)$ be the real toric variety associated to a smooth fan ùõ•. The main purpose of this article is: (i) to determine the fundamental group and the universal cover of $X(\Delta)$, (ii) to give necessary and sufficient conditions on ùõ• under which $\pi_1 (X(\Delta))$ is abelian, (iii) to give necessary and sufficient conditions on ùõ• under which $X(\Delta)$ is aspherical, and when ùõ• is complete, (iv) to give necessary and sufficient conditions for $\mathcal{C}_\Delta$ to be a $K(\pi, 1)$ space where $\mathcal{C}_\Delta$ is the complement of a real subspace arrangement associated to ùõ•.

entry.keywords: Real toric varieties;fundamental group;asphericity;$K(\pi, 1)$ subspace arrangements.

abstract.p: This note proves that, for $F=\mathbb{R},\mathbb{C}$ or $\mathbb{H}$, the bordism classes of all non-bounding Grassmannian manifolds $G_k(F^{n+k})$, with $k < n$ and having real dimension ùëë, constitute a linearly independent set in the unoriented bordism group $\mathfrak{N}_d$ regarded as a $\mathbb{Z}_2$-vector space.

abstract.p: Suppose ùêª is a hyperbolic subgroup of a hyperbolic group ùê∫. Assume there exists $n>0$ such that the intersection of ùëõ essentially distinct conjugates of ùêª is always finite. Further assume ùê∫ splits over ùêª with hyperbolic vertex and edge groups and the two inclusions of ùêª are quasi-isometric embeddings. Then ùêª is quasiconvex in ùê∫. This answers a question of Swarup and provides a partial converse to the main theorem of [23].

entry.title: Rank-One Operators in Reflexive One-Sided $\mathcal{A}$-Submodules

abstract.p: In this paper, we first characterize reflexive one-sided $\mathcal{A}$-submodules $\mathcal{U}$ of a unital operator algebra $\mathcal{A}$ in $\mathcal{B}(\mathcal{H})$ completely. Furthermore we investigate the invariant subspace lattice Lat $\mathcal{R}$ and the reflexive hull Ref $\mathcal{R}$, where $\mathcal{R}$ is the submodule generated by rank-one operators in $\mathcal{U}$; in particular, if $\mathcal{L}$ is a subspace lattice, we obtain when the rank-one algebra $\mathcal{R}$ of $\mathrm{Alg} \mathcal{L}$ is big enough to determined $\mathrm{Alg}\mathcal{L}$ in the following senses: $\mathrm{Alg} \mathcal{L} = \mathrm{Alg} \mathrm{Lat} \mathcal{R}$ and $\mathrm{Alg} \mathcal{L} = \mathrm{Ref} \mathcal{R}$.

abstract.p: In this paper we consider the formally symmetric differential expression $M[\cdot p]$ of any order (odd or even) $\geq 2$. We characterise the dimension of the quotient space $D(T_{\max})/D(T_{\min})$ associated with $M[\cdot p]$ in terms of the behaviour of the determinants
$$\det\limits_{r,s\in N_n}[[f_r g_s](\infty)]$$

where $1 \leq n \leq$ (order of the expression +1); here $[fg](\infty) = \lim\limits_{x\to\infty}[fg](x)$, where $[fg](x)$ is the sesquilinear form in ùëì and ùëî associated with ùëÄ. These results generalise the well-known theorem that ùëÄ is in the limit-point case at $\infty$ if and only if $[fg](\infty)=0$ for every $f, g \in$ the maximal domain ùõ• associated with ùëÄ.

abstract.p: Assuming certain forms of the stream function inverse solutions of an incompressible viscoelastic fluid for a porous medium channel in the presence of Hall currents are obtained. Expressions for streamlines, velocity components and pressure fields are described in each case and are compared with the known viscous and second-grade cases.

entry.title: Picard Groups of the Moduli Spaces of Semistable Sheaves I

abstract.p: We compute the Picard group of the moduli space $U'$ of semistable vector bundles of rank ùëõ and degree ùëë on an irreducible nodal curve ùëå and show that $U'$ is locally factorial. We determine the canonical line bundles of $U'$ and ${U'}_L$, the subvariety consisting of vector bundles with a fixed determinant. On Finite Groups whose Every Proper Normal Subgroup is a Union of a Given Number of Conjugacy Classes

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a finite group and ùê¥ be a normal subgroup of ùê∫. We denote by $ncc(A)$ the number of ùê∫-conjugacy classes of ùê¥ and ùê¥ is called ùëõ-decomposable, if $ncc(A)=n$. Set $\mathcal{K}_G=\{ncc(A)|A\vartriangleleft G\}$. Let ùëã be a non-empty subset of positive integers. A group ùê∫ is called ùëã-decomposable, if $\mathcal{K}_G=X$.

Ashrafi and his co-authors [1‚Äì5] have characterized the ùëã-decomposable non-perfect finite groups for $X=\{1,n\}$ and $n\leq 10$. In this paper, we continue this problem and investigate the structure of ùëã-decomposable non-perfect finite groups, for $X=\{1, 2, 3\}$. We prove that such a group is isomorphic to $Z_6, D_8, Q_8, S_4$, Small Group (20,3), Small Group (24,3), where Small Group $(m, n)$ denotes the $m^{\mathrm{th}}$ group of order ùëõ in the small group library of GAP [11].

entry.title: Superstability of the Generalized Orthogonality Equation on Restricted Domains

abstract.p: Chmieli≈Ñski has proved in the paper [4] the superstability of the generalized orthogonality equation $|\langle f(x),f(y)\rangle|=|\langle x,y\rangle|$. In this paper, we will extend the result of Chmieli≈Ñski by proving a theorem: Let $D_n$ be a suitable subset of $\mathbb{R}^n$. If a function $f: D_n\to\mathbb{R}^n$ satisfies the inequality $||\langle f(x),f(y)\rangle|-|\langle x,y\rangle||\leq\varphi(x,y)$ for an appropriate control function $\varphi(x,y)$ and for all $x,y \in D_n$, then ùëì satisfies the generalized orthogonality equation for any $x,y \in D_n$.

entry.title: Non-Linear Second-Order Periodic Systems with Non-Smooth Potential

abstract.p: In this paper we study second order non-linear periodic systems driven by the ordinary vector ùëù-Laplacian with a non-smooth, locally Lipschitz potential function. Our approach is variational and it is based on the non-smooth critical point theory. We prove existence and multiplicity results under general growth conditions on the potential function. Then we establish the existence of non-trivial homoclinic (to zero) solutions. Our theorem appears to be the first such result (even for smooth problems) for systems monitored by the ùëù-Laplacian. In the last section of the paper we examine the scalar non-linear and semilinear problem. Our approach uses a generalized Landesman‚ÄìLazer type condition which generalizes previous ones used in the literature. Also for the semilinear case the problem is at resonance at any eigenvalue.

entry.keywords: Ordinary vector ùëù-Laplacian;non-smooth critical point theory;locally Lipschitz function;Clarke subdifferential;non-smooth Palais‚ÄìSmale condition;homo-clinic solution;problem at resonance;Poincar√©‚ÄìWirtinger inequality;Landesman‚ÄìLazer type condition.

entry.title: Conductors and Newforms for $U(1,1)$

abstract.p: Let ùêπ be a non-Archimedean local field whose residue characteristic is odd. In this paper we develop a theory of newforms for $U(1,1)(F)$, building on previous work on $SL_2(F)$. This theory is analogous to the results of Casselman for $GL_2(F)$ and Jacquet, Piatetski-Shapiro, and Shalika for $GL_n(F)$. To a representation œÄ of $U(1,1)(F)$, we attach an integer $c(\pi)$ called the conductor of ùúã, which depends only on the ùêø-packet ùõ± containing ùúã. A newform is a vector in ùúã which is essentially fixed by a congruence subgroup of level $c(\pi)$. We show that our newforms are always test vectors for some standard Whittaker functionals, and, in doing so, we give various explicit formulae for newforms.

author.name: K. Paramasamy

entry.title: On the Maximal Dimension of a Completely Entangled Subspace for Finite Level Quantum Systems

abstract.p: Let $\mathcal{H}_i$ be a finite dimensional complex Hilbert space of dimension $d_i$ associated with a finite level quantum system $A_i$ for $i=1, 2,\ldots,k$. A subspace $S\subset\mathcal{H} = \mathcal{H}_{A_1 A_2\ldots A_k} = \mathcal{H}_1 \otimes \mathcal{H}_2 \otimes\cdots\otimes \mathcal{H}_k$ is said to be completely entangled if it has no non-zero product vector of the form $u_1 \otimes u_2 \otimes\cdots\otimes u_k$ with $u_i$ in $\mathcal{H}_i$ for each ùëñ. Using the methods of elementary linear algebra and the intersection theorem for projective varieties in basic algebraic geometry we prove that
$$\max\limits_{S\in\mathcal{E}}\dim S=d_1 d_2\ldots d_k-(d_1+\cdots +d_k)+k-1,$$
where $\mathcal{E}$ is the collection of all completely entangled subspaces.
When $\mathcal{H}_1 = \mathcal{H}_2$ and $k = 2$ an explicit orthonormal basis of a maximal completely entangled subspace of $\mathcal{H}_1 \otimes \mathcal{H}_2$ is given.
We also introduce a more delicate notion of a perfectly entangled subspace for a multipartite quantum system, construct an example using the theory of stabilizer quantum codes and pose a problem.

entry.keywords: Finite level quantum systems;separable states;entangled states;completely entangled subspaces;perfectly entangled subspace;stabilizer quantum code.

abstract.p: In this article, the operator $\Diamond^k_B$ is introduced and named as the Bessel diamond operator iterated ùëò times and is defined by

where $p + q = n, B_{x_i} = \frac{\partial^2}{\partial x^2_i}+\frac{2\upsilon_i}{x_i}\frac{\partial}{\partial x_i}$, where $2\upsilon_i = 2\alpha_i + 1, \alpha_i > - \frac{1}{2} [8], x_i > 0, i = 1, 2,\ldots ,n, k$ is a non-negative integer and ùëõ is the dimension of $\mathbb{R}^+_n$. In this work we study the elementary solution of the Bessel diamond operator and the elementary solution of the operator $\Diamond^k_B$ is called the Bessel diamond kernel of Riesz. Then, we study the Fourier‚ÄìBessel transform of the elementary solution and also the Fourier‚ÄìBessel transform of their convolution.

entry.title: Derivations into Duals of Ideals of Banach Algebras

abstract.p: We introduce two notions of amenability for a Banach algebra $\mathcal{A}$. Let ùêº be a closed two-sided ideal in $\mathcal{A}$, we say $\mathcal{A}$ is ùêº-weakly amenable if the first cohomology group of $\mathcal{A}$ with coefficients in the dual space $I^\ast$ is zero; i.e., $H^1(\mathcal{A},I^\ast) =\{0\}$, and, $\mathcal{A}$ is ideally amenable if $\mathcal{A}$ is ùêº-weakly amenable for every closed two-sided ideal ùêº in $\mathcal{A}$. We relate these concepts to weak amenability of Banach algebras. We also show that ideal amenability is different from amenability and weak amenability. We study the ùêº-weak amenability of a Banach algebra $\mathcal{A}$ for some special closed two-sided ideal ùêº.

where $\frac{1}{2} < \eta < 1$, the non-linear term $f(t,x): (0,1)\times(0,=\infty)\to(-\infty +\infty)$ is continuous and may be singular at $t = 0, t = 1$, and $x = 0$, also may be negative for some values of ùë° and $x, \lambda$ is a positive parameter.

entry.title: Subject Index
Author Index
Zeta Function of the Projective Curve $aY^{2l} = bX^{2l} + cZ^{2l}$ over a Class of Finite Fields, for Odd Primes ùëô

abstract.p: Let ùëù and ùëô be rational primes such that ùëô is odd and the order of ùëù modulo ùëô is even. For such primes ùëù and ùëô, and for $e = l, 2l$, we consider the non-singular projective curves $aY^e = bX^e + cZ^e (abc\neq 0)$ defined over finite fields $F_q$ such that $q = p^\alpha \equiv 1 (\mathrm{mod} e)$. We see that the Fermat curves correspond precisely to those curves among each class (for $e = l, 2l$), that are maximal or minimal over $F_q$. We observe that each Fermat prime gives rise to explicit maximal and minimal curves over finite fields of characteristic 2. For $e = 2l$, we explicitly determine the ùúÅ-function(s) for this class of curves, over $F_q$, as rational functions in the variable ùë°, for distinct cases of $a, b$, and ùëê, in $F^\ast_q$. The ùúÅ-function in each case is seen to satisfy the Weil conjectures (now theorems) for this concrete class of curves.

For $e = l, 2l$, we determine the class numbers for the function fields associated to each class of curves over $F_q$. As a consequence, when the field of definition of the curve(s) is fixed, this provides concrete information on the growth of class numbers for constant field extensions of the function field(s) of the curve(s).

entry.title: On the Structure of ùëù-Zero-Sum Free Sequences and its Application to a Variant of Erd√∂s‚ÄìGinzburg‚ÄìZiv Theorem

abstract.p: Let ùëù be any odd prime number. Let ùëò be any positive integer such that $2 \leq k \leq \left[\frac{p+1}{3}\right]+1$. Let $S =(a_1,a_2,\ldots,a_{2p‚àík})$ be any sequence in $\mathbb{Z}_p$ such that there is no subsequence of length ùëù of ùëÜ whose sum is zero in $\mathbb{Z}_p$. Then we prove that we can arrange the sequence ùëÜ as follows:
$$S=(\underset{u\text{times}}{\underbrace{a,a,\ldots,a}},\underset{v\text{times}}{\underbrace{b,b,\ldots,b}},{a'}_1,{a'}_2,\ldots,{a'}_{2p-k-u-v})$$

where $u\geq v, u + v \geq 2p ‚àí 2k + 2$ and $a ‚àí b$ generates $\mathbb{Z}_p$. This extends a result in [13] to all primes ùëù and ùëò satisfying $(p + 1)/4 + 3\leq k\leq (p + 1)/3 + 1$. Also, we prove that if ùëî denotes the number of distinct residue classes modulo ùëù appearing in the sequence ùëÜ in $\mathbb{Z}_p$ of length $2p ‚àí k(2\leq k\leq [(p + 1)/4]+1)$, and $g\geq 2\sqrt{2}\sqrt{k - 2}$, then there exists a subsequence of ùëÜ of length ùëù whose sum is zero in $\mathbb{Z}_p$.

entry.title: Isometric Multipliers of $L^p(G, X)$

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a locally compact group with a fixed right Haar measure and ùëã a separable Banach space. Let $L^p(G, X)$ be the space of ùëã-valued measurable functions whose norm-functions are in the usual $L^p$. A left multiplier of $L^p(G, X)$ is a bounded linear operator on $L^p(G, X)$ which commutes with all left translations. We use the characterization of isometries of $L^p(G, X)$ onto itself to characterize the isometric, invertible, left multipliers of $L^p(G, X)$ for $1 \leq p < \infty, p \neq 2$, under the assumption that ùëã is not the $l^p$-direct sum of two non-zero subspaces. In fact we prove that if ùëá is an isometric left multiplier of $L^p(G, X)$ onto itself then there exists $a y \in G$ and an isometry ùëà of ùëã onto itself such that $Tf(x) = U(R_y f)(x)$. As an application, we determine the isometric left multipliers of $L^1 \cap L^p(G, X)$ and $L^1 \cap C_0(G, X)$ where ùê∫ is non-compact and ùëã is not the $l^p$-direct sum of two non-zero subspaces. If ùê∫ is a locally compact abelian group and ùêª is a separable Hilbert space, we define $A^p(G, H)=\{f\in l^1(G, H):\hat{f}\in L^p(\Gamma, H)\}$ where ùõ§ is the dual group of ùê∫. We characterize the isometric, invertible, left multipliers of $A^p(G, H)$, provided ùê∫ is non-compact. Finally, we use the characterization of isometries of $C(G,X)$ for ùê∫ compact to determine the isometric left multipliers of $C(G,X)$ provided $X^\ast$ is strictly convex.

entry.keywords: Locally compact group;Haar measure;Banach space-valued measurable functions;isometric multipliers.

entry.title: The Contact Angle in Inviscid Fluid Mechanics

abstract.p: We show that in general, the specification of a contact angle condition at the contact line in inviscid fluid motions is incompatible with the classical field equations and boundary conditions generally applicable to them. The limited conditions under which such a specification is permissible are derived;however, these include cases where the static meniscus is not flat. In view of this situation, the status of the many `solutions‚Äô in the literature which prescribe a contact angle in potential flows comes into question. We suggest that these solutions which attempt to incorporate a phenomenological, but incompatible, condition are in some, imprecise sense `weak-type solutions‚Äô;they satisfy or are likely to satisfy, at least in the limit, the governing equations and boundary conditions everywhere except in the neighbourhood of the contact line. We discuss the implications of the result for the analysis of inviscid flows with free surfaces.

entry.keywords: Free surface flows;inviscid contact angle;finite amplitude motions.

entry.title: Some Properties of Complex Matrix-Variate Generalized Dirichlet Integrals

abstract.p: Dirichlet integrals and the associated Dirichlet statistical densities are widely used in various areas. Generalizations of Dirichlet integrals and Dirichlet models to matrix-variate cases, when the matrices are real symmetric positive definite or hermitian positive definite, are available [4]. Real scalar variables case of the Dirichlet models are generalized in various directions. One such generalization of the type-2 or inverted Dirichlet is looked into in this article. Matrix-variate analogue, when the matrices are hermitian positive definite, are worked out along with some properties which are mathematically and statistically interesting.

entry.keywords: Beta integrals;gamma integrals;complex matrix-variate beta random variables;type-2 Dirichlet model.

entry.title: Homeomorphisms and the Homology of Non-Orientable Surfaces

abstract.p: We show that, for a closed non-orientable surface ùêπ, an automorphism of $H_1(F,\mathbb{Z})$ is induced by a homeomorphism of ùêπ if and only if it preserves the $(\mathrm{mod} 2)$ intersection pairing. We shall also prove the corresponding result for punctured surfaces.

entry.keywords: Non-orientable surfaces;Dehn twist;mapping class groups;crosscap slide.

entry.title: Higher Order Hessian Structures on Manifolds

abstract.p: In this paper we define ùëõth order Hessian structures on manifolds and study them. In particular, when $n=3$, we make a detailed study and establish a one-to-one correspondence between third-order Hessian structures and a certain class of connections on the second-order tangent bundle of a manifold. Further, we show that a connection on the tangent bundle of a manifold induces a connection on the second-order tangent bundle. Also we define second-order geodesics of special second-order connection which gives a geometric characterization of symmetric third-order Hessian structures.

author.name: R. David Kumar
author.affiliation: Department of Collegiate Education, Government of Andhra Pradesh, Hyderabad 500 001, India

entry.title: Degree-Regular Triangulations of Torus and Klein Bottle-Erratum

abstract.p: A triangulation of a connected closed surface is called weakly regular if the action of its automorphism group on its vertices is transitive. A triangulation of a connected closed surface is called degree-regular if each of its vertices have the same degree. Clearly, a weakly regular triangulation is degree-regular. In [8], Lutz has classified all the weakly regular triangulations on at most 15 vertices. In [5], Datta and Nilakantan have classified all the degree-regular triangulations of closed surfaces on at most 11 vertices.

In this article, we have proved that any degree-regular triangulation of the torus is weakly regular. We have shown that there exists an ùëõ-vertex degree-regular triangulation of the Klein bottle if and only if ùëõ is a composite number ‚â• 9. We have constructed two distinct ùëõ-vertex weakly regular triangulations of the torus for each $n ‚â• 12$ and a $(4m+2)$-vertex weakly regular triangulation of the Klein bottle for each $m ‚â• 2$. For $12 ‚â§ n ‚â§ 15$, we have classified all the ùëõ-vertex degree-regular triangulations of the torus and the Klein bottle. There are exactly 19 such triangulations, 12 of which are triangulations of the torus and remaining 7 are triangulations of the Klein bottle. Among the last 7, only one is weakly regular.

entry.keywords: Triangulations of 2-manifolds;regular simplicial maps;combinatorially regular triangulations;degree-regular triangulations.

entry.title: Estimates and Nonexistence of Solutions of the Scalar Curvature Equation on Noncompact Manifolds

abstract.p: This paper is to study the conformal scalar curvature equation on complete noncompact Riemannian manifold of nonpositive curvature. We derive some estimates and properties of supersolutions of the scalar curvature equation, and obtain some nonexistence results for complete solutions of scalar curvature equation.

entry.title: Ideal Amenability of Banach Algebras on Locally Compact Groups

abstract.p: In this paper we study the ideal amenability of Banach algebras. Let $\mathcal{A}$ be a Banach algebra and let ùêº be a closed two-sided ideal in $\mathcal{A}, \mathcal{A}$ is ùêº-weakly amenable if $H^1(\mathcal{A},I^‚àó)=\{0\}$. Further, $\mathcal{A}$ is ideally amenable if $\mathcal{A}$ is ùêº-weakly amenable for every closed two-sided ideal ùêº in $\mathcal{A}$. We know that a continuous homomorphic image of an amenable Banach algebra is again amenable. We show that for ideal amenability the homomorphism property for suitable direct summands is true similar to weak amenability and we apply this result for ideal amenability of Banach algebras on locally compact groups.

abstract.p: The purpose of this note is to describe some algebraic conditions on a Banach algebra which force it to be finite dimensional. One of the main results in Theorem 2 which states that for a locally compact group $G, G$ is compact if there exists a measure ùúá in $\mathrm{Soc} (L^1(G))$ such that $\mu(G) \neq 0$. We also prove that ùê∫ is finite if $\mathrm{Soc}(M(G))$ is closed and every nonzero left ideal in $M(G)$ contains a minimal left ideal.

entry.title: Wavelet Characterization of H√∂rmander Symbol Class $S^m_{\rho,\delta}$ and Applications

abstract.p: In this paper, we characterize the symbol in H√∂rmander symbol class $S^m_{\rho\delta}(m\in R,\rho,\delta\geq 0)$ by its wavelet coefficients. Consequently, we analyse the kernel-distribution property for the symbol in the symbol class $S^m_{\rho,\delta}(m\in R,\rho > 0,\delta\geq 0)$ which is more general than known results; for non-regular symbol operators, we establish sharp $L^2$-continuity which is better than Calder√≥n and Vaillancourt's result, and establish $L^p(1\leq p\leq\infty)$ continuity which is new and sharp. Our new idea is to analyse the symbol operators in phase space with relative wavelets, and to establish the kernel distribution property and the operator's continuity on the basis of the wavelets coefficients in phase space.

entry.keywords: H√∂rmander‚Äôs symbol; wavelet; kernel distribution; operator‚Äôs continuity

entry.title: There are Infinitely many Limit Points of the Fractional Parts of Powers

abstract.p: Suppose that $\alpha > 1$ is an algebraic number and $\xi > 0$ is a real number. We prove that the sequence of fractional parts $\{\xi\alpha^n\},n=1,2,3,\ldots,$ has infinitely many limit points except when ùõº is a PV-number and $\xi\in\mathbb{Q}(\alpha)$. For $\xi=1$ and ùõº being a rational non-integer number, this result was proved by Vijayaraghavan.

entry.title: Commutators of Integral Operators with Variable Kernels on Hardy Spaces

abstract.p: Let $T_{\Omega,\alpha}(0\leq\alpha < n)$ be the singular and fractional integrals with variable kernel $\Omega(x,z)$, and $[b, T_{\Omega,\alpha}]$ be the commutator generated by $T_{\Omega,\alpha}$ and a Lipschitz function ùëè. In this paper, the authors study the boundedness of $[b, T_{\Omega,\alpha}]$ on the Hardy spaces, under some assumptions such as the $L^r$-Dini condition. Similar results and the weak type estimates at the end-point cases are also given for the homogeneous convolution operators $T_{\overline{\Omega},\alpha}(0\leq\alpha < n)$. The smoothness conditions imposed on $\overline{\Omega}$ are weaker than the corresponding known results.

entry.keywords: Singular and fractional integrals;variable kernel;commutator;Hardy space.

entry.title: On the Orders of Finite Semisimple Groups

abstract.p: The aim of this paper is to investigate the order coincidences among the finite semisimple groups and to give a reasoning of such order coincidences through the transitive actions of compact Lie groups.

It is a theorem of Artin and Tits that a finite simple group is determined by its order, with the exception of the groups $(A_3(2), A_2(4))$ and $(B_n(q),C_n(q))$ for $n \geq 3,q$ odd. We investigate the situation for finite semisimple groups of Lie type. It turns out that the order of the finite group $H(\mathbb{F}_q)$ for a split semisimple algebraic group ùêª defined over $\mathbb{F}_q$, does not determine the group ùêª up to isomorphism, but it determines the field $\mathbb{F}_q$ under some mild conditions. We then put a group structure on the pairs $(H_1,H_2)$ of split semisimple groups defined over a fixed field $\mathbb{F}_q$ such that the orders of the finite groups $H_1(\mathbb{F}_q)$ and $H_2(\mathbb{F}_q)$ are the same and the groups $H_i$ have no common simple direct factors. We obtain an explicit set of generators for this abelian, torsion-free group. We finally show that the order coincidences for some of these generators can be understood by the inclusions of transitive actions of compact Lie groups.

entry.keywords: Finite semisimple groups;transitive actions of compact Lie groups;Artin‚Äôs theorem.

entry.title: Transversals in Non-Discrete Groups

abstract.p: The concept of `topological right transversal' is introduced to study right transversals in topological groups. Given any right quasigroup ùëÜ with a Tychonoff topology ùëá, it is proved that there exists a Hausdorff topological group in which ùëÜ can be embedded algebraically and topologically as a right transversal of a subgroup (not necessarily closeed). It is also proved that if a topological right transversal $(S, T_S, T^S, \circ)$ is such that $T_S=T^S$ is a locally compact Hausdorff topology on ùëÜ, then ùëÜ can be embedded as a right transversal of a closed subgroup in a Hausdorff topological group which is universal in some sense.

entry.title: A Note on Generalized Characters

abstract.p: For a compactly generated LCA group ùê∫, it is shown that the set $H(G)$ of all generalized characters on ùê∫ equipped with the compact-open topology is a LCA group and $H(G)=\hat{G}$ (the dual group of ùê∫) if and only if ùê∫ is compact. Both results fail for arbitrary LCA groups. Further, if ùê∫ is second countable, then the Gel‚Äôfand space of the commutative convolution algebra $C_c(G)$ equipped with the inductive limit topology is topologically homeomorphic to $H(G)$.

entry.title: Vector Bundles with a Fixed Determinant on an Irreducible Nodal Curve

abstract.p: Let ùëÄ be the moduli space of generalized parabolic bundles (GPBs) of rank ùëü and degree ùëë on a smooth curve ùëã. Let $M_{\overline{L}}$ be the closure of its subset consisting of GPBs with fixed determinant $\overline{L}$. We define a moduli functor for which $M_{\overline{L}}$ is the coarse moduli scheme. Using the correspondence between GPBs on ùëã and torsion-free sheaves on a nodal curve ùëå of which ùëã is a desingularization, we show that $M_{\overline{L}}$ can be regarded as the compactified moduli scheme of vector bundles on ùëå with fixed determinant. We get a natural scheme structure on the closure of the subset consisting of torsion-free sheaves with a fixed determinant in the moduli space of torsion-free sheaves on ùëå. The relation to Seshadri‚ÄìNagaraj conjecture is studied.

entry.title: Basic Topological and Geometric Properties of Ces√†ro‚ÄìOrlicz Spaces

abstract.p: Necessary and sufficient conditions under which the Ces√†ro‚ÄìOrlicz sequence space $\mathrm{ces}_\phi$ is nontrivial are presented. It is proved that for the Luxemburg norm, Ces√†ro‚ÄìOrlicz spaces $\mathrm{ces}_\phi$ have the Fatou property. Consequently, the spaces are complete. It is also proved that the subspace of order continuous elements in $\mathrm{ces}_\phi$ can be defined in two ways. Finally, criteria for strict monotonicity, uniform monotonicity and rotundity (= strict convexity) of the spaces $\mathrm{ces}_\phi$ are given.

Arithmetic Properties of the Ramanujan Function

abstract.p: We study some arithmetic properties of the Ramanujan function $\tau(n)$, such as the largest prime divisor $P(\tau (n))$ and the number of distinct prime divisors $\omega(\tau(n))$ of $\tau(n)$ for various sequences of ùëõ. In particular, we show that $P(\tau(n)) \geq (\log n)^{33/31+\sigma(1)}$ for infinitely many ùëõ, and
$$P(\tau(p)\tau(p^2)\tau(p^3))>(1+\sigma(1))\frac{\log\log p\log\log\log p}{\log\log\log\log p}$$
for every prime ùëù with $\tau(p)\neq 0$.

entry.title: On Characterisation of Markov Processes Via Martingale Problems

abstract.p: It is well-known that well-posedness of a martingale problem in the class of continuous (or r.c.l.l.) solutions enables one to construct the associated transition probability functions. We extend this result to the case when the martingale problem is well-posed in the class of solutions which are continuous in probability. This extension is used to improve on a criterion for a probability measure to be invariant for the semigroup associated with the Markov process. We also give examples of martingale problems that are well-posed in the class of solutions which are continuous in probability but for which no r.c.l.l. solution exists.

entry.title: Formulation of the Problem of Sonic Boom by a Maneuvering Aerofoil as a One-Parameter Family of Cauchy Problems

abstract.p: For the structure of a sonic boom produced by a simple aerofoil at a large distance from its source we take a physical model which consists of a leading shock (LS), a trailing shock (TS) and a one-parameter family of nonlinear wavefronts in between the two shocks. Then we develop a mathematical model and show that according to this model the LS is governed by a hyperbolic system of equations in conservation form and the system of equations governing the TS has a pair of complex eigenvalues. Similarly, we show that a nonlinear wavefront originating from a point on the front part of the aerofoil is governed by a hyperbolic system of conservation laws and that originating from a point on the rear part is governed by a system of conservation laws, which is elliptic. Consequently, we expect the geometry of the TS to be kink-free and topologically different from the geometry of the LS. In the last section we point out an evidence of kinks on the LS and kink-free TS from the numerical solution of the Euler‚Äôs equations by Inoue, Sakai and Nishida [5].

entry.keywords: Sonic boom;shock propagation;ray theory;elliptic equation;conservation laws;Cauchy problem.

entry.title: The Abstruse Meets the Applicable: Some Aspects of Time-Frequency Analysis

abstract.p: The area of Fourier analysis connected to signal processing theory has undergone a rapid development in the last two decades. The aspect of this development that has received the most publicity is the theory of wavelets and their relatives, which involves expansions in terms of sets of functions generated from a single function by translations and dilations. However, there has also been much progress in the related area known as time-frequency analysis or Gabor analysis, which involves expansions in terms of sets of functions generated from a single function by translations and modulations. In this area there are some questions of a concrete and practical nature whose study reveals connections with aspects of harmonic and functional analysis that were previously considered quite pure and perhaps rather exotic. In this expository paper, I give a survey of some of these interactions between the abstruse and the applicable. It is based on the thematic lectures which I gave at the Ninth Discussion Meeting on Harmonic Analysis at the Harish-Chandra Research Institute in Allahabad in October 2005.

author.name: G. B. Folland
author.affiliation: Department of Mathematics, University of Washington, Seattle, WA 98195-4350, USA

entry.title: On Nyman, Beurling and Baez-Duarte's Hilbert Space Reformulation of the Riemann Hypothesis

abstract.p: There has been a surge of interest of late in an old result of Nyman and Beurling giving a Hilbert space formulation of the Riemann hypothesis. Many authors have contributed to this circle of ideas, culminating in a beautiful refinement due to Baez-Duarte. The purpose of this little survey is to dis-entangle the resulting web of complications, and reveal the essential simplicity of the main results.

entry.title: Non-Euclidean Visibility Problems

abstract.p: We consider the analog of visibility problems in hyperbolic plane (represented by Poincar√© half-plane model $\mathbb{H}$), replacing the standard lattice $\mathbb{Z} \times \mathbb{Z}$ by the orbit $z = i$ under the full modular group $SL_2(\mathbb{Z})$. We prove a visibility criterion and study orchard problem and the cardinality of visible points in large circles.

abstract.p: Given an ùëö-tempered strongly continuous action ùõº of $\mathbb{R}$ by continuous $‚àó$-automorphisms of a Frechet $‚àó$-algebra ùê¥, it is shown that the enveloping $\sigma-C^‚àó$-algebra $E(S(\mathbb{R},A^\infty,\alpha))$ of the smooth Schwartz crossed product $S(\mathbb{R},A^\infty,\alpha)$ of the Frechet algebra $A^\infty$ of $C^\infty$-elements of ùê¥ is isomorphic to the $\sigma-C^‚àó$-crossed product $C^‚àó(\mathbb{R}, E(A), \alpha)$ of the enveloping $\sigma-C^‚àó$-algebra $E(A)$ of ùê¥ by the induced action. When ùê¥ is a hermitian $\mathcal{Q}$-algebra, one gets ùêæ-theory isomorphism $R K_‚àó(S(\mathbb{R},A^\infty,\alpha))=K_‚àó(C^‚àó(\mathbb{R}, E(A),\alpha)$ for the representable ùêæ-theory of Frechet algebras. An application to the differential structure of a $C^‚àó$-algebra defined by densely defined differential seminorms is given.

entry.title: Quotient Normed Cones

abstract.p: Given a normed cone $(X, p)$ and a subcone ùëå, we construct and study the quotient normed cone $(X/Y,\tilde{p})$ generated by ùëå. In particular we characterize the bicompleteness of $(X/Y,\tilde{p})$ in terms of the bicompleteness of $(X, p)$, and prove that the dual quotient cone $((X/Y)^‚àó,\|\cdot\|_{\tilde{p},u})$ can be identified as a distinguished subcone of the dual cone $(X^‚àó,\|\cdot\|_{\tilde{p},u})$. Furthermore, some parts of the theory are presented in the general setting of the space $CL(X,Y)$ of all continuous linear mappings from a normed cone $(X, p)$ to a normed cone $(Y, q)$, extending several well-known results related to open continuous linear mappings between normed linear spaces.

entry.title: Minimal Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger Dilations and Representations of Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger Algebras

abstract.p: Given a contractive tuple of Hilbert space operators satisfying certain ùê¥-relations we show that there exists a unique minimal dilation to generators of Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger algebras or its extension by compact operators. This Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger dilation can be obtained from the classical minimal isometric dilation as a certain maximal ùê¥-relation piece. We define a maximal piece more generally for a finite set of polynomials in ùëõ noncommuting variables. We classify all representations of Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger algebras $\mathcal{O}_A$ obtained from dilations of commuting tuples satisfying ùê¥-relations. The universal properties of the minimal Cuntz‚ÄìKrieger dilation and the WOT-closed algebra generated by it is studied in terms of invariant subspaces.

entry.title: Multiplicity of Nontrivial Solutions for Elliptic Equations with Nonsmooth Potential and Resonance at Higher Eigenvalues

abstract.p: We consider a semilinear elliptic equation with a nonsmooth, locally Lipschitz potential function (hemivariational inequality). Our hypotheses permit double resonance at infinity and at zero (double-double resonance situation). Our approach is based on the nonsmooth critical point theory for locally Lipschitz functionals and uses an abstract multiplicity result under local linking and an extension of the Castro‚ÄìLazer‚ÄìThews reduction method to a nonsmooth setting, which we develop here using tools from nonsmooth analysis.

entry.title: On CNC Commuting Contractive Tuples

abstract.p: The characteristic function has been an important tool for studying completely non-unitary contractions on Hilbert spaces. In this note, we consider completely non-coisometric contractive tuples of commuting operators on a Hilbert space $\mathcal{H}$. We show that the characteristic function, which is now an operator-valued analytic function on the open Euclidean unit ball in $\mathbb{C}^n$, is a complete unitary invariant for such a tuple. We prove that the characteristic function satisfies a natural transformation law under biholomorphic mappings of the unit ball. We also characterize all operator-valued analytic functions which arise as characteristic functions of pure commuting contractive tuples.

Schr√∂dinger Operators on the Half Line: Resolvent Expansions and the Fermi Golden Rule at Thresholds

abstract.p: We consider Schr√∂dinger operators $H= -d^2/dr^2+V$ on $L^2([0,\infty))$ with the Dirichlet boundary condition. The potential ùëâ may be local or non-local, with polynomial decay at infinity. The point zero in the spectrum of ùêª is classified, and asymptotic expansions of the resolvent around zero are obtained, with explicit expressions for the leading coefficients. These results are applied to the perturbation of an eigenvalue embedded at zero, and the corresponding modified form of the Fermi golden rule.

entry.title: Nice Surjections on Spaces of Operators

abstract.p: A bounded linear operator is said to be nice if its adjoint preserves extreme points of the dual unit ball. Motivated by a description due to Labuschagne and Mascioni [9] of such maps for the space of compact operators on a Hilbert space, in this article we consider a description of nice surjections on $\mathcal{K}(X, Y)$ for Banach spaces $X, Y$. We give necessary and sufficient conditions when nice surjections are given by composition operators. Our results imply automatic continuity of these maps with respect to other topologies on spaces of operators. We also formulate the corresponding result for $\mathcal{L}(X, Y)$ thereby proving an analogue of the result from [9] for $L^p(1 < p \neq 2 < \infty)$ spaces. We also formulate results when nice operators are not of the canonical form, extending and correcting the results from [8].

entry.title: Generalized Unitaries and the Picard Group

abstract.p: After discussing some basic facts about generalized module maps, we use the representation theory of the algebra $\mathscr{B}^a(E)$ of adjointable operators on a Hilbert $\mathcal{B}$-module ùê∏ to show that the quotient of the group of generalized unitaries on ùê∏ and its normal subgroup of unitaries on ùê∏ is a subgroup of the group of automorphisms of the range ideal $\mathcal{B}_E$ of ùê∏ in $\mathcal{B}$. We determine the kernel of the canonical mapping into the Picard group of $\mathcal{B}_E$ in terms of the group of quasi inner automorphisms of $\mathcal{B}_E$. As a by-product we identify the group of bistrict automorphisms of the algebra of adjointable operators on ùê∏ modulo inner automorphisms as a subgroup of the (opposite of the) Picard group.

entry.title: The Planar Algebra of a Semisimple and Cosemisimple Hopf Algebra

abstract.p: To a semisimple and cosemisimple Hopf algebra over an algebraically closed field, we associate a planar algebra defined by generators and relations and show that it is a connected, irreducible, spherical, non-degenerate planar algebra with non-zero modulus and of depth two. This association is shown to yield a bijection between (the isomorphism classes, on both sides, of) such objects.

abstract.p: We study homogeneous quantum L√©vy processes and fields with independent additive increments over a noncommutative ∗-monoid. These are described by infinitely divisible generating state functionals, invariant with respect to an endomorphic injective action of a symmetry semigroup. A strongly covariant GNS representation for the conditionally positive logarithmic functionals of these states is constructed in the complex Minkowski space in terms of canonical quadruples and isometric representations on the underlying pre-Hilbert field space. This is of much use in constructing quantum stochastic representations of homogeneous quantum L√©vy fields on It√¥ monoids, which is a natural algebraic way of defining dimension free, covariant quantum stochastic integration over a space-time indexing set.

entry.title: On the Problem of Isometry of a Hypersurface Preserving Mean Curvature-Erratum

abstract.p: The problem of determining the Bonnet hypersurfaces in $R^{n+1}$, for $n>1$, is studied here. These hypersurfaces are by definition those that can be isometrically mapped to another hypersurface or to itself (as locus) by at least one nontrivial isometry preserving the mean curvature. The other hypersurface and/or (the locus of) itself is called Bonnet associate of the initial hypersurface.

The orthogonal net which is called ùê¥-net is special and very important for our study and it is described on a hypersurface. It is proved that, non-minimal hypersurface in $R^{n+1}$ with no umbilical points is a Bonnet hypersurface if and only if it has an ùê¥-net.

entry.title: Semigroups on Frechet Spaces and Equations with Infinite Delays

abstract.p: In this paper, we show existence and uniqueness of a solution to a functional differential equation with infinite delay. We choose an appropriate Frechet space so as to cover a large class of functions to be used as initial functions to obtain existence and uniqueness of solutions.

entry.title: Positive Solutions and Eigenvalue Intervals for Nonlinear Systems

abstract.p: This paper deals with the existence of positive solutions for the nonlinear system
$$(q(t)\phi(p(t){u'}_i(t)))'+f^i(t,u)=0, \quad 0 < t < 1, \quad i=1,2,\ldots,n.$$

This system often arises in the study of positive radial solutions of nonlinear elliptic system. Here $u=(u_1,...,u_n)$ and $f^i,i=1,2,\ldots,n$ are continuous and nonnegative functions, $p(t), q(t):[0, 1]\to(0,\infty)$ are continuous functions. Moreover, we characterize the eigenvalue intervals for
$$(q(t)\phi(p(t){u'}_i(t)))'+\lambda h_i(t)g^i(u)=0,\quad 0 < t < 1, \quad i=1,2,\ldots,n.$$
The proof is based on a well-known fixed point theorem in cones.

entry.keywords: Nonlinear system;ùëù-Laplacian;positive solutions;eigenvalue intervals;fixed point theorem in cones.

entry.title: Strong Convergence of Modified Ishikawa Iterations for Nonlinear Mappings

abstract.p: In this paper, we prove a strong convergence theorem of modified Ishikawa iterations for relatively asymptotically nonexpansive mappings in Banach space. Our results extend and improve the recent results by Nakajo, Takahashi, Kim, $Xu$, Matsushita and some others.

entry.title: Nonconforming $h-p$ Spectral Element Methods for Elliptic Problems

abstract.p: In this paper we show that we can use a modified version of the $h-p$ spectral element method proposed in [6,7,13,14] to solve elliptic problems with general boundary conditions to exponential accuracy on polygonal domains using nonconforming spectral element functions. A geometrical mesh is used in a neighbourhood of the corners. With this mesh we seek a solution which minimizes the sum of a weighted squared norm of the residuals in the partial differential equation and the squared norm of the residuals in the boundary conditions in fractional Sobolev spaces and enforce continuity by adding a term which measures the jump in the function and its derivatives at inter-element boundaries, in fractional Sobolev norms, to the functional being minimized. In the neighbourhood of the corners, modified polar coordinates are used and a global coordinate system elsewhere. A stability estimate is derived for the functional which is minimized based on the regularity estimate in [2]. We examine how to parallelize the method and show that the set of common boundary values consists of the values of the function at the corners of the polygonal domain. The method is faster than that proposed in [6,7,14] and the $h-p$ finite element method and stronger error estimates are obtained.

entry.keywords: Geometrical mesh;stability estimate;least-squares solution;preconditioners;condition numbers;exponential accuracy.

entry.title: A Variant of Davenport's Constant

abstract.p: Let ùëù be a prime number. Let ùê∫ be a finite abelian ùëù-group of exponent ùëõ (written additively) and ùê¥ be a non-empty subset of $]n[:=\{1,2,\ldots,n\}$ such that elements of ùê¥ are incongruent modulo ùëù and non-zero modulo ùëù. Let $k \geq D(G)/|A|$ be any integer where $D(G)$ denotes the well-known Davenport‚Äôs constant. In this article, we prove that for any sequence $g_1,g_2,\ldots,g_k$ (not necessarily distinct) in ùê∫, one can always extract a subsequence $g_{i_1},g_{i_2},\ldots,g_{i_l}$ with $1 \leq l \leq k$ such that
$$\sum\limits_{j=1}^l a_j g_{i_j}=0 \text{in} G,$$

where $a_j\in A$ for all ùëó. We provide examples where this bound cannot be improved. Furthermore, for the cyclic groups, we prove some sharp results in this direction. In the last section, we explore the relation between this problem and a similar problem with prescribed length. The proof of Theorem 1 uses group-algebra techniques, while for the other theorems, we use elementary number theory techniques.

entry.title: Reducing System of Parameters and the Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay Property

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a local ring and let $(x_1,\ldots,x_r)$ be part of a system of parameters of a finitely generated ùëÖ-module ùëÄ, where $r < \dim_R M$. We will show that if $(y_1,\ldots,y_r)$ is part of a reducing system of parameters of ùëÄ with $(y_1,\ldots,y_r)M=(x_1,\ldots,x_r)M$ then $(x_1,\ldots,x_r)$ is already reducing. Moreover, there is such a part of a reducing system of parameters of ùëÄ iff for all primes $P\in \mathrm{Supp} M \cap V_R(x_1,\ldots,x_r)$ with $\dim_R R/P = \dim_R M-r$ the localization $M_P$ of ùëÄ at ùëÉ is an ùëü-dimensional Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay module over $R_P$.

Furthermore, we will show that ùëÄ is a Cohen‚ÄìMacaulay module iff $y_d$ is a non zero divisor on $M/(y_1,\ldots,y_{d-1})M$, where $(y_1,\ldots,y_d)$ is a reducing system of parameters of $M(d:=\dim_R M)$.

abstract.p: Let ùêª be a product of countably infinite number of copies of an uncountable Polish space ùëã. Let $\Sigma_\xi(\overline{\Sigma}_\xi)$ be the class of Borel sets of additive class ùúâ for the product of copies of the discrete topology on ùëã (the Polish topology on ùëã), and let $\mathcal{B}=\cup_{\xi < \omega_1}\overline{\Sigma}_\xi$. entry.title: A Polycycle and Limit Cycles in a Non-Differentiable Predator-Prey Model

abstract.p: For a non-differentiable predator-prey model, we establish conditions for the existence of a heteroclinic orbit which is part of one contractive polycycle and for some values of the parameters, we prove that the heteroclinic orbit is broken and generates a stable limit cycle. In addition, in the parameter space, we prove that there exists a curve such that the unique singularity in the realistic quadrant of the predator-prey model is a weak focus of order two and by Hopf bifurcations we can have at most two small amplitude limit cycles.

entry.title: Infinite Dimensional Differential Games with Hybrid Controls

abstract.p: A two-person zero-sum infinite dimensional differential game of infinite duration with discounted payoff involving hybrid controls is studied. The minimizing player is allowed to take continuous, switching and impulse controls whereas the maximizing player is allowed to take continuous and switching controls. By taking strategies in the sense of Elliott‚ÄìKalton, we prove the existence of value and characterize it as the unique viscosity solution of the associated system of quasi-variational inequalities.

entry.title: Fractional Extensions of some Boundary Value Problems in Oil Strata

abstract.p: In the present paper, we solve three boundary value problems related to the temperature field in oil strata - the fractional extensions of the incomplete lumped formulation and lumped formulation in the linear case and the fractional generalization of the incomplete lumped formulation in the radial case. By using the Caputo differintegral operator and the Laplace transform, the solutions are obtained in integral forms where the integrand is expressed in terms of the convolution of some auxiliary functions of Wright function type. A generalization of the Laplace transform convolution theorem, known as Efros‚Äô theorem is widely used.

entry.title: Equi-Gaussian Curvature Folding

abstract.p: In this paper we introduce a new type of folding called equi-Gaussian curvature folding of connected Riemannian 2-manifolds. We prove that the composition and the cartesian product of such foldings is again an equi-Gaussian curvature folding. In case of equi-Gaussian curvature foldings, $f:M\to P_n$, of an orientable surface ùëÄ onto a polygon $P_n$ we prove that
(i) $f\in\mathcal{F}_{EG}(S^2)\Leftrightarrow n=3$
(ii) $f\in\mathcal{F}_{EG}(T^2)\Rightarrow n=4$
(iii) $f\in\mathcal{F}_{EG}(\# 2T^2)\Rightarrow n=5, 6$
and we generalize (iii) for $\# nT^2$.

entry.title: Classification of Framed Links in 3-Manifolds

abstract.p: We present a short and complete proof of the following Pontryagin theorem, whose original proof was complicated and has never been published in detail. Let ùëÄ be a connected oriented closed smooth 3-manifold, $L_1(M)$ be the set of framed links in ùëÄ up to a framed cobordism, and $\deg: L_1(M)\to H_1(M;\mathbb{Z})$ be the map taking a framed link to its homology class. Then for each $\alpha\in H_1(M;\mathbb{Z})$ there is a one-to-one correspondence between the set $\deg^{-1}\alpha$ and the group $\mathbb{Z}_{2d(\alpha)}$, where $d(\alpha)$ is the divisibility of the projection of ùõº to the free part of $H_1(M;\mathbb{Z})$.

entry.title: Uniqueness of Solutions to Schr√∂dinger Equations on Complex Semi-Simple Lie Groups

abstract.p: In this note we study the time-dependent Schr√∂dinger equation on complex semi-simple Lie groups. We show that if the initial data is a bi-invariant function that has sufficient decay and the solution has sufficient decay at another fixed value of time, then the solution has to be identically zero for all time. We also derive Strichartz and decay estimates for the Schr√∂dinger equation. Our methods also extend to the wave equation. On the Heisenberg group we show that the failure to obtain a parametrix for our Schr√∂dinger equation is related to the fact that geodesics project to circles on the contact plane at the identity.

entry.keywords: Schr√∂dinger equation;uniqueness;Strichartz estimates;complex Lie groups;Heisenberg group.

abstract.p: In this paper we discuss the continuity properties of the integrated density of states for random models based on that of the single site distribution. Our results are valid for models with independent randomness with arbitrary free parts. In particular in the case of the Anderson type models (with stationary, growing, decaying randomness) on the ùë£ dimensional lattice, with or without periodic and almost periodic backgrounds, we show that if the single site distribution is uniformly ùõº-H√∂lder continuous, $0 < \alpha \leq 1$, then the density of states is also uniformly ùõº-H√∂lder continuous.

abstract.p: This note generalizes known results concerning the existence of roots and embedding one-parameter subgroups on ùëù-adic solenoids. An explicit representation of the roots leads to the construction of two distinct rational embedding one-parameter subgroups. As a consequence, the uniqueness of embedding of infinitely divisible probability measures on ùëù-adic solenoids is solved under a certain natural condition.

entry.title: Positive Linear Operators Generated by Analytic Functions

abstract.p: Let ùúë be a power series with positive Taylor coefficients $\{a_k\}^\infty_{k=0}$ and non-zero radius of convergence $r\leq\infty$. Let $\xi_x,\,0\leq x < r$ be a random variable whose values $\alpha_k, k=0,1,\ldots,$ are independent of ùë• and taken with probabilities $a_kx^k/\varphi(x), k=0,1,\ldots$

The positive linear operator $(A_\varphi f)(x):=E[f(\xi_x)]$ is studied. It is proved that if $E(\xi_x)=x,E(\xi^2_x)=qx^2+bx+c,\, q, b, c\in R, q>0$, then $A_\varphi$ reduces to the Sz√°sz‚ÄìMirakyan operator in the case $q=1$, to the limit ùëû-Bernstein operator in the case $0 < q < 1$, and to a modification of the Lupa≈ü operator in the case $q>1$.

entry.title: Extreme Points of the Convex Set of Joint Probability Distributions with Fixed Marginals

abstract.p: By using a quantum probabilistic approach we obtain a description of the extreme points of the convex set of all joint probability distributions on the product of two standard Borel spaces with fixed marginal distributions.

entry.title: Central Limit Theorems for a Class of Irreducible Multicolor Urn Models

abstract.p: We take a unified approach to central limit theorems for a class of irreducible multicolor urn models with constant replacement matrix. Depending on the eigenvalue, we consider appropriate linear combinations of the number of balls of different colors. Then under appropriate norming the multivariate distribution of the weak limits of these linear combinations is obtained and independence and dependence issues are investigated. Our approach consists of looking at the problem from the viewpoint of recursive equations.

entry.title: Some Nonlinear Dynamic Inequalities on Time Scales

abstract.p: The aim of this paper is to investigate some nonlinear dynamic inequalities on time scales, which provide explicit bounds on unknown functions. The inequalities given here unify and extend some inequalities in (B G Pachpatte, On some new inequalities related to a certain inequality arising in the theory of differential equation, J. Math. Anal. Appl. 251 (2000) 736--751).

entry.title: Dynamics and Bifurcations of Travelling Wave Solutions of $R(m, n)$ Equations

abstract.p: By using the bifurcation theory and methods of planar dynamical systems to $R(m, n)$ equations, the dynamical behavior of different physical structures like smooth and non-smooth solitary wave, kink wave, smooth and non-smooth periodic wave, and breaking wave is obtained. The qualitative change in the physical structures of these waves is shown to depend on the systemic parameters. Under different regions of parametric spaces, various sufficient conditions to guarantee the existence of the above waves are given. Moreover, some explicit exact parametric representations of travelling wave solutions are listed.

entry.keywords: $R(m, n)$ equations;solitary wave;periodic wave;breaking wave;solitary cusp wave;periodic cusp wave.

On Automorphisms of some Finite ùëù-Groups

abstract.p: We give a sufficient condition on a finite ùëù-group ùê∫ of nilpotency class 2 so that $\mathrm{Aut}_c(G)=\mathrm{Inn}(G)$, where $\mathrm{Aut}_c(G)$ and $\mathrm{Inn}(G)$ denote the group of all class preserving automorphisms and inner automorphisms of ùê∫ respectively. Next we prove that if ùê∫ and ùêª are two isoclinic finite groups (in the sense of ùëÉ. Hall), then $\mathrm{Aut}_c(G)\cong\mathrm{Aut}_c(H)$. Finally we study class preserving automorphisms of groups of order $p^5,p$ an odd prime and prove that $\mathrm{Aut}_c(G)=\mathrm{Inn}(G)$ for all the groups ùê∫ of order $p^5$ except two isoclinism families.

entry.title: Entire Functions Sharing One Polynomial with their Derivatives

abstract.p: In this paper, we study the growth of solutions of $ak$-th order linear differential equation and that of $ak+1$-th order linear differential equation. From this we affirmatively answer a uniqueness question concerning a conjecture given by Br√ºck in 1996 under the restriction of the hyper order less than 1/2, and obtain some uniqueness theorems of a nonconstant entire function and its derivative sharing a finite nonzero complex number CM. The results in this paper also improve some known results. Some examples are provided to show that the results in this paper are best possible.

entry.title: Sums of the Squares of Terms of Sequence $\{u_n\}$

abstract.p: In this paper, we consider generalized Fibonacci type second order linear recurrence $\{u_n\}$. We derive a generating matrix for both the sums of squares, $\sum^n_{i=0}u^2_i$ and the products of the form $u_nu_{n+2}$. We also derive explicit formulas for the sums and products by using matrix methods. Then we give a matrix method to generate the sums of product of two consecutive terms $u_n u_{n+1}$ as well as the product, $u_n u_{n+2}$. Further we give generating functions and combinatorial representations of the sums of squares of terms of $\{u_n\}$ and the product, $u_n u_{n+2}$.

entry.keywords: Second order recurrence;sums of squares;generating function;matrix method.

entry.title: Parabolic Bundles on Algebraic Surfaces I -- The Donaldson-Uhlenbeck Compactification

abstract.p: The aim of this paper is to construct the parabolic version of the Donaldson-Uhlenbeck compactification for the moduli space of parabolic stable bundles on an algebraic surface with parabolic structures along a divisor with normal crossing singularities. We prove the non-emptiness of the moduli space of parabolic stable bundles of rank 2.

entry.title: Torsionfree Sheaves over a Nodal Curve of Arithmetic Genus One

abstract.p: We classify all isomorphism classes of stable torsionfree sheaves on an irreducible nodal curve of arithmetic genus one defined over $\mathbb{C}$. Let ùëã be a nodal curve of arithmetic genus one defined over $\mathbb{R}$, with exactly one node, such that ùëã does not have any real points apart from the node. We classify all isomorphism classes of stable real algebraic torsionfree sheaves over ùëã of even rank. We also classify all isomorphism classes of real algebraic torsionfree sheaves over ùëã of rank one.

entry.title: VrƒÉnceanu Connections and Foliations with Bundle-Like Metrics

abstract.p: We show that the VrƒÉnceanu connection which was initially introduced on non-holonomic manifolds can be used to study the geometry of foliated manifolds. We prove that a foliation is totally geodesic with bundle-like metric if and only if this connection is a metric one. We introduce the notion of a foliated Riemannian manifold of constant transversal VrƒÉnceanu curvature and the notion of a transversal Einstein foliated Riemannian manifold. The geometry of these two classes of manifolds is studied and the relationship between them is determined.

entry.keywords: Foliation;VrƒÉnceanu connection;foliation with bundle-like metric;foliated Riemannian manifold of constant transversal VrƒÉnceanu curvature;transversal Einstein foliated Riemannian manifold.

entry.title: Realizations of the Canonical Representation

abstract.p: A characterisation of the maximal abelian subalgebras of the bounded operators on Hilbert space that are normalised by the canonical representation of the Heisenberg group is given. This is used to classify the perfect realizations of the canonical representation.

author.name: M. K. Vemuri
author.affiliation: Chennai Mathematical Institute, Plot H1, SIPCOT IT Park, Padur P.O., Siruseri 603 103, India

entry.title: Low-Cost Control Problems on Perforated and Non-Perforated Domains

abstract.p: We study the homogenization of a class of optimal control problems whose state equations are given by second order elliptic boundary value problems with oscillating coefficients posed on perforated and non-perforated domains. We attempt to describe the limit problem when the cost of the control is also of the same order as that describing the oscillations of the coefficients. We study the situations where the control and the state are both defined over the entire domain or when both are defined on the boundary.

Large Deviations: An Introduction to 2007 Abel Prize

abstract.p: 2007 Abel prize has been awarded to S R S Varadhan for creating a unified theory of large deviations. We attempt to give a flavour of this branch of probability theory, highlighting the role of Varadhan.

entry.title: Some Zero-Sum Constants with Weights

abstract.p: For an abelian group ùê∫, the Davenport constant $D(G)$ is defined to be the smallest natural number ùëò such that any sequence of ùëò elements in ùê∫ has a non-empty subsequence whose sum is zero (the identity element). Motivated by some recent developments around the notion of Davenport constant with weights, we study them in some basic cases. We also define a new combinatorial invariant related to $(\mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z})^d$, more in the spirit of some constants considered by Harborth and others and obtain its exact value in the case of $(\mathbb{Z}/n\mathbb{Z})^2$ where ùëõ is an odd integer.

entry.title: On the Finiteness Properties of Matlis Duals of Local Cohomology Modules

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a complete semi-local ring with respect to the topology defined by its Jacobson radical, $\mathfrak{a}$ an ideal of ùëÖ, and ùëÄ a finitely generated ùëÖ-module. Let $D_R(-):=\mathrm{Hom}_R(-,E)$, where ùê∏ is the injective hull of the direct sum of all simple ùëÖ-modules. If ùëõ is a positive integer such that $\mathrm{Ext}^j_R(R/\mathfrak{a},D_R(H^t_{\mathfrak{a}}(M)))$ is finitely generated for all $t>n$ and all $j\geq 0$, then we show that $\mathrm{Hom}_R(R/\mathfrak{a},D_R(H^n_{\mathfrak{a}}(M)))$ is also finitely generated. Specially, the set of prime ideals in $\mathrm{Coass}_R(H^n_{\mathfrak{a}}(M))$ which contains $\mathfrak{a}$ is finite.

Next, assume that $(R,\mathfrak{m})$ is a complete local ring. We study the finiteness properties of $D_R(H^r_{\mathfrak{a}}(R))$ where ùëü is the least integer ùëñ such that $H^i_{\mathfrak{a}}(R)$ is not Artinian.

entry.title: A Geometric Approach to the Kronecker Problem I: The Two Row Case

abstract.p: Given two irreducible representations $\mu,\upsilon$ of the symmetric group $S_d$, the Kronecker problem is to find an explicit rule, giving the multiplicity of an irreducible representation, ùúÜ, of $S_d$, in the tensor product of ùúá and ùúê. We propose a geometric approach to investigate this problem. We demonstrate its effectiveness by obtaining explicit formulas for the tensor product multiplicities, when the irreducible representations are parameterized by partitions with at most two rows.

entry.title: Euler Characteristic and Quadrilaterals of Normal Surfaces

abstract.p: Let ùëÄ be a compact 3-manifold with a triangulation ùúè. We give an inequality relating the Euler characteristic of a surface ùêπ normally embedded in ùëÄ with the number of normal quadrilaterals in ùêπ. This gives a relation between a topological invariant of the surface and a quantity derived from its combinatorial description. Secondly, we obtain an inequality relating the number of normal triangles and normal quadrilaterals of ùêπ, that depends on the maximum number of tetrahedrons that share a vertex in ùúè.

author.name: Tejas Kalelkar
author.affiliation: Stat-Math Unit, Indian Statistical Institute, Bangalore 560 009, India

entry.title: Push-Outs of Derivations

abstract.p: Let $\mathfrak{A}$ be a Banach algebra and let ùëã be a Banach $\mathfrak{A}$-bimodule. In studying $\mathcal{H}^1(\mathfrak{A},X)$ it is often useful to extend a given derivation $D:\mathfrak{A}\to X$ to a Banach algebra $\mathfrak{B}$ containing $\mathfrak{A}$ as an ideal, thereby exploiting (or establishing) hereditary properties. This is usually done using (bounded/unbounded) approximate identities to obtain the extension as a limit of operators $b\mapsto D(ba)-b.D(a), a\in\mathfrak{A}$ in an appropriate operator topology, the main point in the proof being to show that the limit map is in fact a derivation. In this paper we make clear which part of this approach is analytic and which algebraic by presenting an algebraic scheme that gives derivations in all situations at the cost of enlarging the module. We use our construction to give improvements and shorter proofs of some results from the literature and to give a necessary and sufficient condition that biprojectivity and biflatness is inherited to ideals.

entry.title: Regularities of Multifractal Measures

abstract.p: First, we prove the decomposition theorem for the regularities of multifractal Hausdorff measure and packing measure in $\mathbb{R}^d$. This decomposition theorem enables us to split a set into regular and irregular parts, so that we can analyze each separately, and recombine them without affecting density properties. Next, we give some properties related to multifractal Hausdorff and packing densities. Finally, we extend the density theorem in [6] to any measurable set.

entry.title: Sharp Bounds on the Ranks of Negativity of Certain Sums

abstract.p: If ùëÄ is a complex vector space and $\langle\cdot p,\cdot p\rangle$ a Hermitian sesquilinear form on ùëÄ with a finite rank of negativity ùëò (i.e., ùëò is the maximal dimension of any linear subspace ùê∏ of ùëÄ satisfying $\langle x,x\rangle < 0$ for each nonzero ùë• in ùê∏), if ùëõ is a positive integer, and if $a_1,\ldots,a_n$ are endomorphisms of ùëÄ, then it is easy to see that the Hermitian sesquilinear form
\begin{equation*}(x, y)\mapsto\sum\limits_{v=1}^n\langle a_v x, a_v y\rangle\end{equation*}

on ùëÄ has rank of negativity at most $nk$. It is also fairly easy to see that the bound $nk$ cannot be improved in general. Less trivial is the fact that it cannot be improved by making the following assumption:

(a) the space ùëÄ is the *-algebra $A:=C[[\omega_1,\omega_2]]$ of polynomials in two self-adjoint non-commuting indeterminates; there is a (necessarily Hermitian) linear form ùúë on ùê¥ such that $\langle x, y\rangle =\varphi(y^\ast x)(x, y, \in A)$; and each $a_v$ is just left multiplication by some element of ùê¥ (which we may denote by `a_v' at no great risk of confusion).
Now suppose that, with $M,\langle \cdot p ,\cdot p\rangle, k,n$, and $a_1,\ldots,a_n$ as initially, the following two conditions are satisfied:
(i) each $a_v$ has a formal adjoint $a^\ast_v$, being an endomorphism of ùëÄ such that
$$\langle a_v x, y\rangle = \langle x,a^\ast_v y\rangle\quad (x, y \in M)$$;
(ii) the mappings $a_1,\ldots,a_n, a^\ast_1,\ldots,a^\ast_n$ commute pairwise.

Then the bound $nk$ can be replaced by ùëò (regardless of how large ùëõ may be). This result cannot be improved in general since it may happen that each $a_v$ is a scalar multiple of the identical mapping of ùëÄ into itself (not all $a_v$ equal to 0), in which case the form (1) is a positive multiple of $\langle \cdot p ,\cdot p\rangle itself.$
There are ties with the subjects of `positive semidefinite submodules' (`positive semidefinite left ideals') and `definitisation'.

abstract.p: We develop techniques of connections of roots for split Lie algebras with symmetric root systems. We show that any of such algebras ùêø is of the form $L=\mathcal{U}+\sum_j I_j$ with $\mathcal{U}$ a subspace of the abelian Lie algebra ùêª and any $I_j$ a well described ideal of ùêø, satisfying $[I_j,I_k]=0$ if $j\neq k$. Under certain conditions, the simplicity of ùêø is characterized and it is shown that ùêø is the direct sum of the family of its minimal ideals, each one being a simple split Lie algebra with a symmetric root system and having all its nonzero roots connected.

entry.keywords: Infinite dimensional Lie algebras;split Lie algebras;roots.

entry.title: The Structure of some Classes of ùêæ-Contact Manifolds

abstract.p: We study projective curvature tensor in ùêæ-contact and Sasakian manifolds. We prove that (1) if a ùêæ-contact manifold is quasi projectively flat then it is Einstein and (2) a ùêæ-contact manifold is ùúâ-projectively flat if and only if it is Einstein Sasakian. Necessary and sufficient conditions for a ùêæ-contact manifold to be quasi projectively flat and ùúë-projectively flat are obtained. We also prove that for a $(2n+1)$-dimensional Sasakian manifold the conditions of being quasi projectively flat, ùúë-projectively flat and locally isometric to the unit sphere $S^{2n+1}(1)$ are equivalent. Finally, we prove that a compact ùúë-projectively flat ùêæ-contact manifold with regular contact vector field is a principal $S^1$-bundle over an almost Kaehler space of constant holomorphic sectional curvature 4.

entry.title: Holomorphic Two-Spheres in Complex Grassmann Manifold $G(2, 4)$

abstract.p: In this paper, we use the harmonic sequence to study the linearly full holomorphic two-spheres in complex Grassmann manifold $G(2,4)$. We show that if the Gaussian curvature ùêæ (with respect to the induced metric) of a non-degenerate holomorphic two-sphere satisfies $K\leq 2$ (or $K\geq 2$), then ùêæ must be equal to 2. Simultaneously, we show that one class of the holomorphic two-spheres with constant curvature 2 is totally geodesic. Concerning the degenerate holomorphic two-spheres, if its Gaussian curvature $K\leq 1$ (or $K\geq 1$), then $K=1$. Moreover, we prove that all holomorphic two-spheres with constant curvature 1 in $G(2,4)$ must be $U(4)$-equivalent.

As a natural extension of a result due to Lutwak, an $L_p$-type affine isoperimetric inequality, whose special cases are $L_p$-Busemann‚ÄìPetty centroid inequality and $L_p$-affine projection inequality, respectively, is established. Some $L_p$-mixed volume inequalities involving $L_p$-projection bodies are also established.

entry.title: Limit Algebras of Differential Forms in Non-Commutative Geometry

abstract.p: Given a C‚àó-normed algebra A which is either a Banach ‚àó-algebra or a Frechet ‚àó-algebra, we study the algebras ‚àûA and A obtained by taking respectively the projective limit and the inductive limit of Banach ‚àó-algebras obtained by completing the universal graded differential algebra ‚àóA of abstract non-commutative differential forms over A. Various quantized integrals on ‚àûA induced by a K-cycle on A are considered. The GNS-representation of ‚àûA defined by a d-dimensional non-commutative volume integral on a d+-summable K-cycle on A is realized as the representation induced by the left action of A on ‚àóA. This supplements the representation A on the space of forms discussed by Connes (Ch. VI.1, Prop. 5, p. 550 of [C]).

entry.title: Quantum Random Walks and their Convergence to Evans-Hudson Flows

abstract.p: Using coordinate-free basic operators on toy Fock spaces, quantum random walks are defined following the ideas of Attal and Pautrat. Extending the result for one dimensional noise, strong convergence of quantum random walks associated with bounded structure maps to Evans‚ÄìHudson flow is proved under suitable assumptions. Starting from the bounded generator of a given uniformly continuous quantum dynamical semigroup on a von Neumann algebra, we have constructed quantum random walks which converges strongly and the strong limit gives an Evans‚ÄìHudson dilation for the semigroup.

entry.title: An Optimal Version of an Inequality Involving the Third Symmetric Means

abstract.p: Let $(GA)^{[k]}_n(a), A_n(a), G_n(a)$ be the third symmetric mean of ùëò degree, the arithmetic and geometric means of $a_1,\ldots,a_n(a_i>0,i=1,\ldots,n)$, respectively. By means of descending dimension method, we prove that the maximum of ùëù is $\frac{k-1}{n-1}$ and the minimum of ùëû is $\frac{n}{n-1}\left(\frac{k-1}{k}\right)^{\frac{k}{n}}$ so that the inequalities
$$(G_n(a))^{1-p}(A_n(a))^p\leq (GA)^{[k]}_n(a)\leq (1-q)G_n(a)+q A_n(a) (2\leq k\leq n-1)$$
hold.

abstract.p: A ring is called right ùëÉ-coherent if every principal right ideal is finitely presented. Let $M_R$ be a right ùëÖ-module. entry.title: Harmonic Riemannian Maps on Locally Conformal Kaehler Manifolds

abstract.p: We study harmonic Riemannian maps on locally conformal Kaehler manifolds ($lcK$ manifolds). We show that if a Riemannian holomorphic map between $lcK$ manifolds is harmonic, then the Lee vector field of the domain belongs to the kernel of the Riemannian map under a condition. When the domain is Kaehler, we prove that a Riemannian holomorphic map is harmonic if and only if the $lcK$ manifold is Kaehler. Then we find similar results for Riemannian maps between $lcK$ manifolds and Sasakian manifolds. Finally, we check the constancy of some maps between almost complex (or almost contact) manifolds and almost product manifolds.

entry.keywords: Kaehler manifold;Sasakian manifold;locally conformal Kaehler manifold;harmonic map, Riemannian map;holomorphic map.

abstract.p: We give an identification between the planar algebra of the subgroup-subfactor $R \rtimes H \subset R \rtimes G$ and the ùê∫-invariant planar subalgebra of the planar algebra of the bipartite graph $\star_n$, where $n=[G:H]$. The crucial step in this identification is an exhibition of a model for the basic construction tower, and thereafter of the standard invariant of $R \rtimes H \subset R \rtimes G$ in terms of operator matrices.

We also obtain an identification between the planar algebra of the fixed algebra subfactor $R^G \subset R^H$ and the ùê∫-invariant planar subalgebra of the planar algebra of the `flip‚Äô of $\star_n$.

entry.title: Some Properties of Unbounded Operators with Closed Range

abstract.p: Let $H_1, H_2$ be Hilbert spaces and ùëá be a closed linear operator defined on a dense subspace $D(T)$ in $H_1$ and taking values in $H_2$. In this article we prove the following results:
(i) Range of ùëá is closed if and only if 0 is not an accumulation point of the spectrum $\sigma(T^\ast T)$ of $T^\ast T$,
In addition, if $H_1=H_2$ and ùëá is self-adjoint, then
(ii) $\inf \{\| Tx\|:x\in D(T)\cap N(T)^\perp \| x\|=1\}=\inf\{| \lambda|:0\neq\lambda\in\sigma(T)\}$,
(iii) Every isolated spectral value of ùëá is an eigenvalue of ùëá,
(iv) Range of ùëá is closed if and only if 0 is not an accumulation point of the spectrum $\sigma(T)$ of ùëá,
(v) $\sigma(T)$ bounded implies ùëá is bounded.
We prove all the above results without using the spectral theorem. Also, we give examples to illustrate all the above results.

entry.keywords: Densely defined operator;closed operator;Moore‚ÄìPenrose inverse;reduced minimum modulus.

entry.title: Vanishing of the Top Local Cohomology Modules over Noetherian Rings

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a (not necessarily local) Noetherian ring and ùëÄ a finitely generated ùëÖ-module of finite dimension ùëë. Let $\mathfrak{a}$ be an ideal of ùëÖ and $\mathfrak{M}$ denote the intersection of all prime ideals $\mathfrak{p}\in\mathrm{Supp}_R H^d_a(M)$. It is shown that
$$H^d_a(M)\simeq H^d_{\mathfrak{M}}(M)/\sum\limits_{n\in\mathbb{N}}\langle \mathfrak{M}\rangle(0:_{H^d_{\mathfrak{M}}(M)}a^n),$$

where for an Artinian ùëÖ-module ùê¥ we put $\langle\mathfrak{M}\rangle A=\cap_{n\in\mathbb{N}}\mathfrak{M}^n A$. As a consequence, it is proved that for all ideals $\mathfrak{a}$ of ùëÖ, there are only finitely many non-isomorphic top local cohomology modules $H^d_a(M)$ having the same support. In addition, we establish an analogue of the Lichtenbaum‚ÄìHartshorne vanishing theorem over rings that need not be local.

entry.title: On the Theorem of ùëÄ Golomb

abstract.p: Let $X_1,\ldots,X_n$ be compact spaces and $X=X_1\times\cdots\times X_n$. abstract.p: Let $(X, d)$ be a compact metric and $0 < \alpha < 1$. The space $\mathrm{Lip}^\alpha(X)$ of H√∂lder functions of order ùõº is the Banach space of all functions ùëì from ùëã into $\mathbb{K}$ such that $\| f\|=\max \{\| f\|_\infty,L(f)\} <\infty$, where

entry.title: On the Torus Cobordant Cohomology Spheres

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a compact Lie group. In 1960, P A Smith asked the following question: ``Is it true that for any smooth action of ùê∫ on a homotopy sphere with exactly two fixed points, the tangent ùê∫-modules at these two points are isomorphic?" A result due to Atiyah and Bott proves that the answer is `yes‚Äô for $\mathbb{Z}_p$ and it is also known to be the same for connected Lie groups. In this work, we prove that two linear torus actions on $S^n$ which are ùëê-cobordant (cobordism in which inclusion of each boundary component induces isomorphisms in $\mathbb{Z}$-cohomology) must be linearly equivalent. As a corollary, for connected case, we prove a variant of Smith‚Äôs question.

abstract.p: In [1], we defined $c(G),q(G)$ and $p(G)$. In this paper we will show that if ùê∫ is a ùëù-group, where ùëù is an odd prime and $|G|\leq p^4$, then $c(G)=q(G)=p(G)$. However, the question of whether or not there is a ùëù-group ùê∫ with strict inequality $c(G)=q(G) < p(G)$ is still open.

entry.title: Clean Elements in Abelian Rings

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a ring with identity. An element in ùëÖ is said to be clean if it is the sum of a unit and an idempotent. ùëÖ is said to be clean if all of its elements are clean. If every idempotent in ùëÖ is central, then ùëÖ is said to be abelian. In this paper we obtain some conditions equivalent to being clean in an abelian ring.

entry.title: On a Class of Semicommutative Modules

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a ring with identity, ùëÄ a right ùëÖ-module and $S=\mathrm{End}_R(M)$. In this note, we introduce ùëÜ-semicommutative, ùëÜ-Baer, $S-q.$-Baer and $S-p.q.$-Baer modules. We study the relations between these classes of modules. Also we prove if ùëÄ is an ùëÜ-semicommutative module, then ùëÄ is an $S-p.q.$-Baer module if and only if $M[x]$ is an $S[x]-p.q.$-Baer module, ùëÄ is an ùëÜ-Baer module if and only if $M[x]$ is an $S[x]$-Baer module, ùëÄ is an $S-q.$-Baer module if and only if $M[x]$ is an $S[x]-q.$-Baer module.

entry.keywords: Baer modules;principally quasi-Baer modules;quasi-Baer modules;semicommutative modules.
