abstract.p: In this paper, we prove a conjecture of Yakubovich regarding limit shapes of `slices‚Äô of two-dimensional (2D) integer partitions and compositions of ùëõ when the number of summands $m\sim An^\alpha$ for some $A>0$ and $\alpha < \frac{1}{2}$. We prove that the probability that there is a summand of multiplicity ùëó in any randomly chosen partition or composition of an integer ùëõ goes to zero asymptotically with ùëõ provided ùëó is larger than a critical value. As a corollary, we strengthen a result due to Erd√∂s and Lehner (Duke Math. J. 8(1941) 335‚Äì345) that concerns the relation between the number of integer partitions and compositions when $\alpha=\frac{1}{3}$.

entry.title: Remark on an Infinite Semipositone Problem with Indefinite Weight and Falling Zeros

abstract.p: In this work, we consider the positive solutions to the singular problem
\begin{equation*}\begin{cases}-\Delta u=am(x)u-f(u)-\frac{c}{u^\alpha} & \text{in}\quad\Omega,\\ u=0 & \text{on}\quad\partial\Omega,\end{cases}\end{equation*}

where $0 < \alpha < 1,a>0$ and $c>0$ are constants, ùõ∫ is a bounded domain with smooth boundary $\partial\Omega,\Delta$ is a Laplacian operator, and $f:[0,\infty]\longrightarrow\mathbb{R}$ is a continuous function. The weight functions $m(x)$ satisfies $m(x)\in C(\Omega)$ and $m(x)>m_0>0$ for $x\in\Omega$ and also $\|m\|_\infty=l < \infty$. We assume that there exist $A>0, M>0,p>1$ such that $alu-M\leq f(u)\leq Au^p$ for all $u\in[0,\infty)$. We prove the existence of a positive solution via the method of sub-supersolutions when $m_0 a>\frac{2\lambda_1}{1+\alpha}$ and ùëê is small. Here $\lambda_1$ is the first eigenvalue of operator $-\Delta$ with Dirichlet boundary conditions.

entry.keywords: Infinite semipositone problems;indefinite weight;falling zeros;sub-supersolution method.

entry.title: Characteristic Classes for $GO(2n)$ in √©tale Cohomology

abstract.p: Let $GO(2n)$ be the general orthogonal group (the group of similitudes) over any algebraically closed field of characteristic $\neq 2$. We determine the smooth-√©tale cohomology ring with $\mathbb{F}_2$ coefficients of the algebraic stack $BGO(2n)$. In the topological category, Holla and Nitsure determined the singular cohomology ring of the classifying space $BGO(2n)$ of the complex Lie group $GO(2n)$ in terms of explicit generators and relations. We extend their results to the algebraic category. The chief ingredients in this are: (i) an extension to √©tale cohomology of an idea of Totaro, originally used in the context of Chow groups, which allows us to approximate the classifying stack by quasi projective schemes; and (ii) construction of a Gysin sequence for the $\mathbb{G}_m$-fibration $BO(2n)\to BGO(2n)$ of algebraic stacks.

entry.title: Series Solutions and a Perturbation Formula for the Extended Rayleigh Problem of Hydrodynamic Stability

abstract.p: We generalize Tollmien‚Äôs solutions of the Rayleigh problem of hydrodynamic stability to the case of arbitrary channel cross sections, known as the extended Rayleigh problem. We prove the existence of a neutrally stable eigensolution with wave number $k_s>0$; it is also shown that instability is possible only for $0 < k < k_s$ and not for $k>k_s$. Then we generalize the Tollmien‚ÄìLin perturbation formula for the behavior of $c_i$, the imaginary part of the phase velocity as the wave number $k\to k_s$ ‚àí to the extended Rayleigh problem and subsequently, we use this formula to demonstrate the instability of a particular shear flow.

In this paper we give a different upper bound when ùê¥ is a tensor product of quaternion algebras and ùúé is a the tensor product of canonical involutions. entry.title: Maps into Projective Spaces

abstract.p: We compute the cohomology of the Picard bundle on the desingularization $\overline{J}^d (Y)$ of the compactified Jacobian of an irreducible nodal curve ùëå. We use it to compute the cohomology classes of the Brill‚ÄìNoether loci in $\overline{J}^d(Y)$.

We show that the moduli space ùëÄ of morphisms of a fixed degree from ùëå to a projective space has a smooth compactification. As another application of the cohomology of the Picard bundle, we compute a top intersection number for the moduli space ùëÄ confirming the Vafa‚ÄìIntriligator formulae in the nodal case.

abstract.p: We will produce a smooth projective scheme ùëã over $\mathbb{Z}$, a rank 2 vector bundle ùëâ on ùëã with a line subbundle ùêø having the following property. For a prime ùëù, let $F_p$ be the absolute Fobenius of $X_p$, and let $L_p\subset V_p$ be the restriction of $L\subset V$. Then for almost all primes ùëù, and forall $t\geq 0,(F^‚àó_p)^t L_P\subset (F^‚àó_p)^t V_p$ is a non-split Harder-Narasimhan filtration. In particular, $(F^‚àó_p)^t V_p$ is not a direct sum of strongly semistable bundles for any ùë°. This construction works for any full flag veriety $G/B$, with semisimple rank of $G\geq 2$. entry.title: On a Class of Smooth Frechet Subalgebras of $C^\ast$-Algebras

abstract.p: The paper contributes to understanding the differential structure in a $C^‚àó$-algebra. Refining the Banach $(D^‚àó_p)$-algebras investigated by Kissin and Shulman as noncommutative analogues of the algebra $C^p[a,b]$ of ùëù-times continuously differentiable functions, we investigate a Frechet $(D^‚àó\infty)$-subalgebra $\mathcal{B}$ of a $C^‚àó$-algebra as a noncommutative analogue of the algebra $C^\infty[a,b]$ of smooth functions. Regularity properties like spectral invariance, closure under functional calculi and domain invariance of homomorphisms are derived expressing $\mathcal{B}$ as an inverse limit over ùëõ of Banach $(D^‚àó_n)$-algebras. Several examples of such smooth algebras are exhibited.

Using this we develop an outgoing Cuntz scattering system which gives rise to an input‚Äìoutput formalism. A transfer function is introduced for the system. entry.title: Hyperbolicity in Median Graphs

abstract.p: If ùëã is a geodesic metric space and $x_1,x_2,x_3\in X$, a geodesic triangle $T=\{x_1,x_2,x_3\}$ is the union of the three geodesics $[x_1 x_2],[x_2 x_3]$ and $[x_3 x_1]$ in ùëã. The space ùëã is ùõø-hyperbolic (in the Gromov sense) if any side of ùëá is contained in a ùõø-neighborhood of the union of the two other sides, for every geodesic triangle ùëá in ùëã. If ùëã is hyperbolic, we denote by $\delta(X)$ the sharp hyperbolicity constant of ùëã, i.e.,$\delta(X)=\inf\{\delta\geq 0: X \quad\text{is}\quad \delta-\text{hyperbolic}\}$. In this paper we study the hyperbolicity of median graphs and we also obtain some results about general hyperbolic graphs. In particular, we prove that a median graph is hyperbolic if and only if its bigons are thin.

entry.keywords: Median graph;Gromov hyperbolicity;Gromov hyperbolic graph;infinite graphs;geodesics.

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a finite group, and $n(G)$ be the set of the number of subgroups of possible order of ùê∫. We investigate the structure of ùê∫ satisfying that $n(G) = \{1, m\}$ for any positive integer $m > 1$. At first, we prove that the nilpotent length of ùê∫ is less than 2. Secondly, we investigate nilpotent groups with $m = p + 1$ or $p^2 + p + 1$ (ùëù is a prime), and we get the classification of such kinds of groups. abstract.p: An Alexander dual of a multipermutohedron ideal has many combinatorial properties. A combinatorial formula for all the multigraded Betti numbers of an Alexander dual of multipermutohedron ideals are also obtained.

entry.title: Real Parabolic Vector Bundles over a Real Curve

abstract.p: We define real parabolic structures on real vector bundles over a real curve. Let $(X, \sigma_X)$ be a real curve, and let $S\subset X$ be a non-empty finite subset of ùëã such that $\sigma_X(S) = S$. Let $N\geq 2$ be an integer. We construct an ùëÅ-fold cyclic cover ùëù: $Y\to X$ in the category of real curves, ramified precisely over each point of ùëÜ, and with the property that for any element ùëî of the Galois group ùõ§, and any $y\in Y$, one has $\sigma_Y(gy) = g^{-1}\sigma_Y(y)$. We established an equivalence between the category of real parabolic vector bundles on $(X,\sigma_X)$ with real parabolic structure over ùëÜ, all of whose weights are integral multiples of $1/N$, and the category of real ùõ§-equivariant vector bundles on $(Y, \sigma_Y)$.

entry.title: On Approximation of Lie Groups by Discrete Subgroups

abstract.p: A locally compact group ùê∫ is said to be approximated by discrete sub-groups (in the sense of T√¥yama) if there is a sequence of discrete subgroups of ùê∫ that converges to ùê∫ in the Chabauty topology (or equivalently, in the Vietoris topology). The notion of approximation of Lie groups by discrete subgroups was introduced by T√¥yama in Kodai Math. Sem. Rep. 1 (1949) 36‚Äì37 and investigated in detail by Kuranishi in Nagoya Math. J. 2 (1951) 63‚Äì71. It is known as a theorem of T√¥yama that any connected Lie group approximated by discrete subgroups is nilpotent. The converse, in general, does not hold. For example, a connected simply connected nilpotent Lie group is approximated by discrete subgroups if and only if ùê∫ has a rational structure. On the other hand, if ùõ§ is a discrete uniform subgroup of a connected, simply connected nilpotent Lie group ùê∫ then ùê∫ is approximated by discrete subgroups $\Gamma_n$ containing ùõ§. The proof of the above result is by induction on the dimension of ùê∫, and gives an algorithm for inductively determining $\Gamma_n$. The purpose of this paper is to give another proof in which we present an explicit formula for the sequence $(\Gamma_n)_{n\geq 0}$ in terms of ùõ§. Several applications are given.

entry.keywords: Nilpotent Lie group;rational structure;discrete uniform subgroup;lattice subgroup;Chabauty topology;Vietoris topology.

\begin{align*}(-1)^n u^{\Delta^{2n}}(t)+\lambda p(t) f(\upsilon(\sigma(t)))=0, & t\in[a, b],\\ (-1)^n\upsilon^{\Delta^{2n}} (t) + \mu q(t)g (u(\sigma(t))) = 0, & t\in [a, b],\end{align*}
satisfying the Sturm‚ÄìLiouville boundary conditions

\begin{align*}& \alpha_{i+1}u^{\Delta^{2i}}(a)-\beta_{i+1}u^{\Delta^{2i+1}}(a)=0, \gamma_{i+1}u^{\Delta^{2i}}(\sigma(b))+\delta_{i+1}u^{\Delta^{2i+1}}(\sigma(b))=0,\\ & \alpha_{i+1}\upsilon^{\Delta^{2i}}(a)-\beta_{i+1}\upsilon^{\Delta^{2i+1}}(a)=0,\gamma_{i+1}\upsilon^{\Delta^{2i}}(\sigma(b))+\delta_{i+1}\upsilon^{\Delta^{2i+1}}(\sigma(b))=0,\end{align*}
for $0\leq i\leq n-1$. To this end we apply a Guo‚ÄìKrasnosel‚Äôskii fixed point theorem.

entry.keywords: Time scales;system of equations;boundary value problem;eigenvalue intervals;positive solution;cone.

abstract.p: In this paper, we introduce weighted Besov spaces and weighted Triebel‚ÄìLizorkin spaces associated with different homogeneities and prove that the composition of two Calder√≥n‚ÄìZygmund operators is bounded on these spaces. This extends a recent result in Han et al, Revista Mat. Iber.

entry.title: Vector-Valued almost Convergence and Classical Properties in Normed Spaces

abstract.p: In this paper we study the almost convergence and the almost summability in normed spaces. Among other things, spaces of sequences defined by the almost convergence and the almost summability are proved to be complete if the basis normed space is so. Finally, some classical properties such as completeness, reflexivity, Schur property, Grothendieck property, and the property of containing a copy of $c_0$ are characterized in terms of the almost convergence.

entry.title: General $L_p$-Harmonic Blaschke Bodies

abstract.p: Lutwak introduced the harmonic Blaschke combination and the harmonic Blaschke body of a star body. Further, Feng and Wang introduced the concept of the $L_p$-harmonic Blaschke body of a star body. In this paper, we define the notion of general $L_p$-harmonic Blaschke bodies and establish some of its properties. In particular, we obtain the extreme values concerning the volume and the $L_p$-dual geominimal surface area of this new notion.

entry.keywords: General $L_p$-harmonic Blaschke bodies;$L_p$-harmonic Blaschke bodies;extreme values.

entry.title: A Statistic on ùëõ-Color Compositions and Related Sequences

abstract.p: A composition of a positive integer in which a part of size ùëõ may be assigned one of ùëõ colors is called an ùëõ-color composition. Let $a_m$ denote the number of ùëõ-color compositions of the integer ùëö. It is known that $a_m = F_{2m}$ for all $m \geq 1$, where $F_m$ denotes the Fibonacci number defined by $F_m = F_{m-1}+F_{m-2}$ if $m\geq 2$, with $F_0=0$ and $F_1=1$. A statistic is studied on the set of ùëõ-color compositions of ùëö thus providing a polynomial generalization of the sequence $F_{2m}$. The statistic may be described, equivalently, in terms of statistics on linear tilings and lattice paths. The restriction to the set of ùëõ-color compositions having a prescribed number of parts is considered and an explicit formula for the distribution is derived. We also provide ùëû-generalizations of relations between $a_m$ and the number of self-inverse ùëõ-compositions of $2m+1$ or $2m$. Finally, we consider a more general recurrence than that satisfied by the numbers $a_m$ and note some particular cases.

entry.title: Repdigits in ùëò-Lucas Sequences

abstract.p: For an integer $k\geq 2$, let $(L_n^{(k)})_n$ be the ùëò-Lucas sequence which starts with $0,\ldots,0,2,1$ (ùëò terms) and each term afterwards is the sum of the ùëò preceding terms. In 2000, Luca (Port. Math. 57(2) 2000 243-254) proved that 11 is the largest number with only one distinct digit (the so-called repdigit) in the sequence $(L_n^{(2)})_n$. In this paper, we address a similar problem in the family of ùëò-Lucas sequences. We also show that the ùëò-Lucas sequences have similar properties to those of ùëò-Fibonacci sequences and occur in formulae simultaneously with the latter.

entry.keywords: Generalized Fibonacci and Lucas numbers;lower bounds for nonzero linear forms in logarithms of algebraic numbers;repdigits.

entry.title: Gaussian Curvature on Hyperelliptic Riemann Surfaces

abstract.p: Let ùê∂ be a compact Riemann surface of genus $g \geq 1, \omega_1,\ldots,\omega_g$ be a basis of holomorphic 1-forms on ùê∂ and let $H=(h_{ij})^g_{i,j=1}$ be a positive definite Hermitian matrix. It is well known that the metric defined as $ds_H^2=\sum^g_{i,j=1}h_{ij}\omega_i\otimes \overline{\omega_j}$ is a K\"a hler metric on ùê∂ of non-positive curvature. Let $K_H:C\to \mathbb{R}$ be the Gaussian curvature of this metric. When ùê∂ is hyperelliptic we show that the hyperelliptic Weierstrass points are non-degenerated critical points of $K_H$ of Morse index +2. In the particular case when ùêª is the $g\times g$ identity matrix, we give a criteria to find local minima for $K_H$ and we give examples of hyperelliptic curves where the curvature function $K_H$ is a Morse function.

entry.title: On $IA$-Automorphisms that Fix the Centre Element-Wise

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a group. An automorphism of ùê∫ is called an $IA$-automorphism if it induces the identity mapping on $G/\gamma 2(G)$, where $\gamma 2(G)$ is the commutator sub-group of ùê∫. Let $IA_z(G)$ be the group of those $IA$-automorphisms, which fix the centre element-wise and let Autcent $(G)$ be the group of central automorphisms, the automorphisms that induce the identity mapping on the central quotient. It can be observed that Autcent $(G)=C_{\mathrm{Aut}(G)}(IA_z(G))$. We prove that $IA_z(G)$ and $IA_z(H)$ are isomorphic for any two finite isoclinic groups ùê∫ and ùêª. Also, for a finite ùëù-group ùê∫, we give a necessary and sufficient condition to ensure that $IA_z(G)=\mathrm{Autcent}(G)$.

entry.title: Perturbation of Operators and Approximation of Spectrum

abstract.p: Let $A(x)$ be a norm continuous family of bounded self-adjoint operators on a separable Hilbert space $\mathbb{H}$ and let $A(x)_n$ be the orthogonal compressions of $A(x)$ to the span of first ùëõ elements of an orthonormal basis of $\mathbb{H}$. The problem considered here is to approximate the spectrum of $A(x)$ using the sequence of eigenvalues of $A(x)_n$. We show that the bounds of the essential spectrum and the discrete spectral values outside the bounds of essential spectrum of $A(x)$ can be approximated uniformly on all compact subsets by the sequence of eigenvalue functions of $A(x)_n$. The known results, for a bounded self-adjoint operator, are translated into the case of a norm continuous family of operators. Also an attempt is made to predict the existence of spectral gaps that may occur between the bounds of essential spectrum of $A(0)=A$ and study the effect of norm continuous perturbation of operators in the prediction of spectral gaps. As an example, gap issues of some block Toeplitz‚ÄìLaurent operators are discussed. The pure linear algebraic approach is the main advantage of the results here.

entry.keywords: Operator;perturbation;essential spectrum;spectral gap;Toeplitz operators and matrices.

abstract.p: Let ùëá be a rooted tree, ùê∫ a connected graph, $x,y\in V(G)$ be fixed and $G_i$‚Äôs be $|V(T)|$ disjoint copies of ùê∫ with $x_i$ and $y_i$ denoting the corresponding copies of ùë• and ùë¶ in $G_i$, respectively. We define the ùëá-repetition of ùê∫ to be the graph obtained by joining $y_i$ to $x_j$ for each $i\in V(T)$ and each child ùëó of ùëñ. In this paper, we compute the Kirchhoff index of the ùëá-repetition of ùê∫ in terms of parameters of ùëá and ùê∫. Also we study how $Kf(G)$ behaves under some graph operations such as joining vertices or subdividing edges.

entry.title: Diagrams for Certain Quotients of $PSL(2, \mathbb{Z}[i])$

abstract.p: Actions of the Picard group $PSL(2,\mathbb{Z}[i])$ on $PL(F_p)$, where $p\equiv 1(\mathrm{mod} 4)$, are investigated through diagrams. Each diagram is composed of fragments of three types. A technique is developed to count the number of fragments which frequently occur in the diagrams for the action of the Picard group on $PL(F_p)$. The conditions of existence of fixed points of the transformations are evolved. It is further proved that the action of the Picard group on $PL(F_p)$ is transitive. A code in Mathematica is developed to perform the calculation.

entry.keywords: Bianchi group;Picard group;coset diagrams;quadratic number fields.

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a reductive algebraic group over a field ùëò of characteristic zero, let $X\to S$ be a smooth projective family of curves over ùëò, and let ùê∏ be a principal ùê∫ bundle on ùëã. The main result of this note is that for each Harder‚ÄìNarasimhan type ùúè there exists a locally closed subscheme $S^\tau (E)$ of ùëÜ which satisfies the following universal property. If $f:T\to S$ is any base-change, then ùëì factors via $S^\tau (E)$ if and only if the pullback family $f^‚àóE$ admits a relative canonical reduction of Harder‚ÄìNarasimhan type ùúè. As a consequence, all principal bundles of a fixed Harder‚ÄìNarasimhan type form an Artin stack. We also show the existence of a schematic Harder‚ÄìNarasimhan stratification for flat families of pure sheaves of ùõ¨-modules (in the sense of Simpson) in arbitrary dimensions and in mixed characteristic, generalizing the result for sheaves of $\mathcal{O}$-modules proved earlier by Nitsure. This again has the implication that ùõ¨-modules of a fixed Harder‚ÄìNarasimhan type form an Artin stack.

entry.title: On the Stability of the $L^p$-Norm of the Riemannian Curvature Tensor

abstract.p: We consider the Riemannian functional $\mathcal{R}_p(g)=\int_M|R(g)|^p dv_g$ defined on the space of Riemannian metrics with unit volume on a closed smooth manifold ùëÄ where $R(g)$ and $dv_g$ denote the corresponding Riemannian curvature tensor and volume form and $p\in (0,\infty)$. First we prove that the Riemannian metrics with non-zero constant sectional curvature are strictly stable for $\mathcal{R}_p$ for certain values of ùëù. Then we conclude that they are strict local minimizers for $\mathcal{R}_p$ for those values of ùëù. Finally generalizing this result we prove that product of space forms of same type and dimension are strict local minimizer for $\mathcal{R}_p$ for certain values of ùëù.

We also reprove the theorem: Ricci flat harmonic manifolds are flat, which is generally affirmed by appealing to Cheeger‚ÄìGromov splitting theorem. We also confirm that if a harmonic manifold ùëÄ has same volume density function as $\mathbb{R}^n$, then ùëÄ is flat.

entry.title: On Quadratic Variation of Martingales

abstract.p: We give a construction of an explicit mapping
$$\Psi: D([0,\infty),\mathbb{R})\to D([0,\infty),\mathbb{R}),$$
where $D([0,\infty), \mathbb{R})$ denotes the class of real valued r.c.l.l. functions on $[0,\infty)$ such that for a locally square integrable martingale $(M_t)$ with r.c.l.l. paths,
$$\Psi(M.(\omega))=A.(\omega)$$

gives the quadratic variation process (written usually as $[M,M]_t$) of $(M_t)$. We also show that this process $(A_t)$ is the unique increasing process $(B_t)$ such that $M_t^2-B_t$ is a local martingale, $B_0=0$ and
$$\mathbb{P}((\Delta B)_t=[(\Delta M)_t]^2, 0 < \infty)=1.$$

Apart from elementary properties of martingales, the only result used is the Doob‚Äôs maximal inequality. This result can be the starting point of the development of the stochastic integral with respect to r.c.l.l. martingales.

entry.title: An Engel condition with an additive mapping in semiprime rings

abstract.p: The main purpose of this paper is to prove the following result: Let $n \gt 1$ be a fixed integer, let ùëÖ be a $n!$-torsion free semiprime ring, and let $f : R \to R$ be an additive mapping satisfying the relation $[f (x), x]_{n} = [[... [[f(x),x],x],...], x] = 0$ for all $x \in R$. In this case $[f(x), x] = 0$ is fulfilled for all $x \in R$. Since any semisimple Banach algebra (for example, $C^{\ast}$ algebra) is semiprime, this purely algebraic result might be of some interest from functional analysis point of view.

entry.title: Finite groups all of whose minimal subgroups are $NE^{\ast}$-subgroups

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a finite group. A subgroup ùêª of ùê∫ is called an $NE$-subgroup of ùê∫ if it satisfies $H^G \cap N_{G}(H) = H$. A subgroup ùêª of ùê∫ is said to be a $NE^{\ast}$-subgroup of ùê∫ if there exists a subnormal subgroup ùëá of ùê∫ such that $G = HT$ and $H \cap T$ is a $NE$-subgroup of ùê∫. In this article, we investigate the structure of ùê∫ under the assumption that subgroups of prime order are $NE^{\ast}$-subgroups of ùê∫. The finite groups, all of whose minimal subgroups of the generalized Fitting subgroup are $NE^{\ast}$-subgroups are classified.

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be a finite group. A subgroup ùêª of ùê∫ is called ùë†-permutable in ùê∫ if it permutes with every Sylow subgroup of ùê∫, and ùê∫ is called a $PS$-group if all minimal subgroups and cyclic subgroups with order 4 of ùê∫ are ùë†-permutable in ùê∫. In this paper, we give a complete classification of finite groups which are not $PS$-groups but their proper subgroups are all $PS$-groups.

entry.title: Nash equilibria via duality and homological selection

abstract.p: Given a multifunction from ùëã to the ùëò-fold symmetric product Sym$_{k}(X)$, we use the Dold‚ÄìThom theorem to establish a homological selection theorem. This is used to establish existence of Nash equilibria. Cost functions in problems concerning the existence of Nash equilibria are traditionally multilinear in the mixed strategies. The main aim of this paper is to relax the hypothesis of multilinearity. We use basic intersection theory, Poincar√© duality in addition to the Dold‚ÄìThom theorem.

entry.title: Limit distributions of random walks on stochastic matrices

abstract.p: Problems similar to Ann. Prob. 22 (1994) 424‚Äì430 and J. Appl. Prob. 23 (1986) 1019‚Äì1024 are considered here. The limit distribution of the sequence $X_{n}X_{n‚àí1}\ldots X_{1}$, where $(X_{n})_{n\geq 1}$ is a sequence of i.i.d. $2 \times 2$ stochastic matrices with each $X_{n}$ distributed as ùúá, is identified here in a number of discrete situations. A general method is presented and it covers the cases when the random components $C_{n}$ and $D_{n}$ (not necessarily independent), $(C_{n}, D_{n})$ being the first column of $X_{n}$, have the same (or different) Bernoulli distributions. Thus $(C_{n}, D_{n})$ is valued in $\{0, r\}^{2}$, where ùëü is a positive real number. If for a given positive real ùëü, with $0 \lt r \leq \frac{1}{2}$, $r^{-1}C_{n}$ and $r^{-1}D_{n}$ are each Bernoulli with parameters $p_{1}$ and $p_{2}$ respectively, $0 < p_{1}$, $p_{2} \lt 1$ (which means $C_{n}\sim p_{1}\delta_{\{r\}} + (1 - p_{1})\delta_{\{0\}}$ and $D_{n} \sim p_{2}\delta_{\{r\}} + (1 - p_{2})\delta_{\{0\}}$), then it is well known that the weak limit ùúÜ of the sequence $\mu^{n}$ exists whose support is contained in the set of all $2 \times 2$ rank one stochastic matrices. We show that $S(\lambda)$, the support of ùúÜ, consists of the end points of a countable number of disjoint open intervals and we have calculated the ùúÜ-measure of each such point. To the best of our knowledge, these results are new.

entry.title: General Editorial on Publication Ethics
Co-Roman domination in graphs

abstract.p: Let $G = (V,E)$ be a graph and let $f:V\to \{0, 1, 2\}$ be a function. A vertex ùë¢ is said to be protected with respect to ùëì if $f(u)> 0$ or $f(u)=0$ and ùë¢ is adjacent to a vertex with positive weight. The function ùëì is a co-Roman dominating function (CRDF) if: (i) every vertex in ùëâ is protected, and (ii) each $v \in V$ with $f(v) > 0$ has a neighbor $u\in V$ with $f(u)=0$ such that the function $f_{vu}: V\to \{0,1,2\}$, defined by $f_{vu}(u)=1$, $f_{vu}(v)=f(v)-1$ and $f_{vu}(x)=f(x)$ for $x\in V\backslash \{u,v\}$ has no unprotected vertex. The weight of ùëì is $w(f)=\Sigma_{v\in V} f(v)$. The co-Roman domination number of a graph ùê∫, denoted by $\gamma_{cr}(G)$, is the minimum weight of a co-Roman dominating function on ùê∫. In this paper we initiate a study of this parameter, present several basic results, as well as some applications and directions for further research. We also show that the decision problem for the co-Roman domination number is NP-complete, even when restricted to bipartite, chordal and planar graphs.

entry.keywords: Domination; Roman domination; weak Roman domination; co-Roman domination.

abstract.p: Let ùëÖ be a commutative Noetherian ring and let ùê∂ be a semidualizing ùëÖ-module. It is shown that a finitely generated ùëÖ-module ùëÄ with finite $G_{C}$-dimension is ùê∂-reflexive if and only if $M_{\mathfrak{p}}$ is $C_{\mathfrak{p}}$-reflexive for $\mathfrak{p}\in \text{Spec} (R)$ with depth $(R_{\mathfrak{p}})\leq 1$, and $G_{C_{\mathfrak{p}}} - \dim R_{\mathfrak{p}}(M_{\mathfrak{p}})\leq $ depth $(R_{\mathfrak{p}}) - 2$ for $\mathfrak{p}\in \text{Spec} (R)$ with depth $(R_{\mathfrak{p}})\geq 2$. As the ring $R$ itself is a semidualizing module, this result gives a generalization of a natural setting for extension of results due to Serre and Samuel (see Czech. Math. J. 62(3) (2012) 663-672 and Beitr√§ge Algebra Geom. 50(2) (2009) 353-362). In addition, it is shown that over ring ùëÖ with $\dim R\leq n$, where $n\geq 2$ is an integer, $G_{D}-\dim_{R}(Hom_{R}(M,D))\leq n-2$ for every finitely generated ùëÖ-module ùëÄ and a dualizing ùëÖ-module ùê∑.

entry.title: Strongly minimal triangulations of $(S^{3}\times S^{1})^{\# 3}$ and $(S^{3}\times S^{1})^{\# 3}$

abstract.p: A triangulated ùëë-manifold ùêæ, satisfies the inequality $\binom{f_{0}(K)-d-1}{2}\geq \binom{d+2}{2}\beta_{1}(K;\mathbb{Z}_{2})$ for $d\geq 3$. The triangulated ùëë-manifolds that meet the bound with equality are called tight neighbourly. In this paper, we present tight neighbourly triangulations of 4-manifolds on 15 vertices with $\mathbb{Z}_{3}$ as an automorphism group. entry.title: Quadratic independence of coordinate functions of certain homogeneous spaces and action of compact quantum groups

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ be one of the classical compact, simple, centre-less, connected Lie groups of rank ùëõ with a maximal torus ùëá, the Lie algebra $\mathcal{G}$ and let $\{E_{i},F_{i},H_{i},i=1,\ldots,n\}$ be tha standard set of generators corresponding to a basis of the root system. Consider the adjoint-orbit space $M=\{\text{Ad}_{g}(H_{1}), g\in G\}$, identified with the homogeneous space $G/L$ where $L=\{g\in G : \text{Ad}_{g}(H_{1})=H_{1}\}$. We prove that the coordinate functions $f_{i}(g):=\gamma_{i}(\text{Ad}_{g}(H_{1}))$, $i=1,\ldots,n$, where $\{\gamma_{1},\ldots,\gamma_{n}\}$ is basis of $\mathcal{G}'$ are `quadratically independent' in the sense that they do not satisfy any nontrivial homogeneous quadratic relations among them. Using this, it is proved that there is no genuine compact quantum group which can act faithfully on $C(M)$ such that the action leaves invariant the linear span of the above coordinate functions. As a corollary, it is also shown that any compact quantum group having a faithful action on the noncommutative manifold obtained by Rieffel deformation of ùëÄ satisfying a similar `linearity' condition must be a Rieffel-Wang type deformation of some compact group.

entry.keywords: Quantum isometry; compact quantum group; homogeneous spaces; simple Lie groups.

In this article, we extend a result of Sadhu and Singh by finding a necessary and sufficient condition on an integral birational extension ùê¥ ⊆ ùêµ of integral domains with dim ùê¥ ≤ 1, so that the natural map $\mathcal{I}$(ùê¥, ùêµ) $\to$ $\mathcal{I}(A[X,X^{-1}],B[X,X^{-1}])$ is an isomorphism. In the same situation, we show that if dim ùê¥ ≥ 2, then the condition is necessary but not sufficient. We also discuss some properties of the cokernel of the natural map $\mathcal{I}(A,B)\to \mathcal{I}[X,X^{-1}], B[X,X^{-1}])$ in the general case.

entry.title: Smoothness of limit functors

abstract.p: Let ùëÜ be a scheme. Assume that we are given an action of the one dimensional split torus $\mathbb{G}_{m,S}$ on a smooth affine ùëÜ-scheme $\mathfrak{X}$. We consider the limit (also called attractor) subfunctor $\mathfrak{X}_{\lambda}$ consisting of points whose orbit under the given action `admits a limit at 0‚Äô. We show that $\mathfrak{X}_{\lambda}$ is representable by a smooth closed subscheme of $\mathfrak{X}$. This result generalizes a theorem of Conrad et al. (Pseudo-reductive groups (2010) Cambridge Univ. Press) where the case when $\mathfrak{X}$ is an affine smooth group and $\mathbb{G}_{m,S}$ acts as a group automorphisms of $\mathfrak{X}$ is considered. It also occurs as a special case of a recent result by Drinfeld on the action of $\mathbb{G}_{m,S}$ on algebraic spaces (Proposition 1.4.20 of Drinfeld V, On algebraic spaces with an action of $\mathfrak{G}_{m}$, preprint 2013) in case ùëÜ is of finite type over a field.

entry.keywords: Group schemes; torus action; limit subscheme.

entry.title: Revisiting the Zassenhaus conjecture on torsion units for the integral group rings of small groups

abstract.p: In recent years several new restrictions on integral partial augmentations for torsion units of $\mathbb{Z}G$ have been introduced, which have improved the effectiveness of the Luthar‚ÄìPassi method for checking the Zassenhaus conjecture for specific groups ùê∫. In this note, we report that the Luthar‚ÄìPassi method with the new restrictions are sufficient to verify the Zassenhaus conjecture with a computer for all groups of order less than 96, except for one group of order 48 ‚Äì the non-split covering group of ùëÜ4, and one of order 72 of isomorphism type (ùê∂ × ùê∂) × ùê∑8. To verify the Zassenhaus conjecture for this group we give a new construction of normalized torsion units of $\mathbb{Q}G$ that are not conjugate to elements of $\mathbb{Z}G$.

entry.keywords: Integral group rings; torsion units; Zassenhaus conjectures.

abstract.p: We introduce and study an integral of Hilbert valued functions with respect to Hilbert valued measures. The integral is sesquilinear (bilinear in the real case) and takes scalar values. Basic properties of this integral are studied and some examples are introduced.

entry.title: $(2n-1)$-Ideal amenability of triangular banach algebras

abstract.p: Let $\mathcal{A}$ and $\mathcal{B}$ be two unital Banach algebras and let $\mathcal{M}$ be an unital Banach $\mathcal{A}$, $\mathcal{B}$-module. Also, let $\mathcal{T}=\left[\begin{smallmatrix} \mathcal{A} & \mathcal{M}\\ & \mathcal{B}\end{smallmatrix}\right]$ be the corresponding triangular Banach algebra. Forrest and Marcoux (Trans. Amer. Math. Soc. 354 (2002) 1435‚Äì1452) have studied the ùëõ-weak amenability of triangular Banach algebras. In this paper, we investigate $(2n-1)$-ideal amenability of $\mathcal{T}$ for all ùëõ ≥ 1. We introduce the structure of ideals of these Banach algebras and then, we show that $(2n-1)$-ideal amenability of $\mathcal{T}$ depends on $(2n-1)$-ideal amenability of Banach algebras $\mathcal{A}$ and $\mathcal{B}$.

entry.title: Morozov-type discrepancy principle for nonlinear ill-posed problems under ùúÇ-condition

abstract.p: For proving the existence of a regularization parameter under a Morozov-type discrepancy principle for Tikhonov regularization of nonlinear ill-posed problems, it is required to impose additional nonlinearity assumptions on the forward operator. Lipschitz continuity of the Fre√©chet derivative and requirement of the Lipschitz constant to depend on a source condition is one such restriction (Ramlau P, Numer. Funct. Anal. Optim. 23(1&22) (2003) 147‚Äì172). Another nonlinearity condition considered by Scherzer (Computing, 51 (1993) 45‚Äì60) was by requiring the forward operator to be close to a linear operator in a restricted sense. A seemingly natural nonlinear assumption which appears in many applications which attracted attention in various contexts of the study of nonlinear problems is the so-called ùúÇ-condition. However, a Morozov-type discrepancy principle together with ùúÇ-condition does not seem to have been studied, except in a recent paper by the author (Bull. Aust. Math. Soc. 79 (2009) 337‚Äì342), where error estimates under a general source condition is derived, by assuming the existence of the parameter. In this paper, the existence of the parameter satisfying a Morozov-type discrepancy principle is proved under the ùúÇ-condition on the forward operator, by assuming the source condition as in the papers of Scherzer (Computing, 51 (1993) 45‚Äì60) and Ramlau (Numer. Funct. Anal. Optim. 23(1&22) (2003) 147‚Äì172). This source condition is, in fact, a special case of the source condition in the author‚Äôs paper (Bull. Aust. Math. Soc. 79 (2009) 337‚Äì342).

entry.keywords: Tikhonov regularization; nonlinear ill-posed problems; discrepancy principle; ùúÇ-condition.

entry.title: ‚Ñé- ùëù Spectral element methods for three dimensional elliptic problems on non-smooth domains, Part-I: Regularity estimates and stability theorem

abstract.p: This is the first of a series of papers devoted to the study of ‚Ñé- ùëù spectral element methods for solving three dimensional elliptic boundary value problems on non-smooth domains using parallel computers. In three dimensions there are three different types of singularities namely; the vertex, the edge and the vertex-edge singularities. In addition, the solution is anisotropic in the neighbourhoods of the edges and vertex-edges. To overcome the singularities which arise in the neighbourhoods of vertices, vertex-edges and edges, we use local systems of coordinates. These local coordinates are modified versions of spherical and cylindrical coordinate systems in their respective neighbourhoods. Away from these neighbourhoods standard Cartesian coordinates are used. In each of these neighbourhoods we use a geometrical mesh which becomes finer near the corners and edges. The geometrical mesh becomes a quasi-uniform mesh in the new system of coordinates. We then derive differentiability estimates in these new set of variables and state our main stability estimate theorem using a non-conforming ‚Ñé- ùëù spectral element method whose proof is given in a separate paper.

entry.keywords: Spectral element method; non-smooth domains; geometric mesh; vertex singularity; edge singularity; vertex-edge singularity; differentiability estimates; stability estimates; exponential accuracy.

entry.title: A note on neighborhood total domination in graphs

abstract.p: Let ùê∫ = (ùëâ ,ùê∏) be a graph without isolated vertices. A dominating set ùëÜ of ùê∫ is called a neighborhood total dominating set (or just NTDS) if the induced subgraph ùê∫[ùëÅ(ùëÜ)] has no isolated vertex. The minimum cardinality of a NTDS of ùê∫ is called the neighborhood total domination number of ùê∫ and is denoted by ùõænt(ùê∫). In this paper, we obtain sharp bounds for the neighborhood total domination number of a tree. We also prove that the neighborhood total domination number is equal to the domination number in several classes of graphs including grid graphs.

entry.title: On the coefficient conjecture of Clunie and Sheil-Small on univalent harmonic mappings

abstract.p: In this paper, we first prove the coefficient conjecture of Clunie and Sheil-Small for a class of univalent harmonic functions which includes functions convex in some direction. Next, we prove growth and covering theorems and some related results. Finally, we propose two conjectures, an affirmative answer to one of which would then imply, for example, a solution to the conjecture of Clunie and Sheil-Small.

entry.keywords: Harmonic functions; stable harmonic functions; harmonic univalent; harmonic convex; convex in one direction; growth and covering theorems; coefficient bound.

entry.title: Some spherical analysis related to the pairs ($U(n),H_n$) and ($U(p, q),H_n$), $p + q = n$

abstract.p: In this paper, we define the normalized spherical transform associated with the generalized Gelfand pair $(U(p, q),H_n)$, where $H_n$ is the Heisenberg group $2n + 1$-dimensional and $p+q = n$. We show that the normalized spherical transform $\mathfrak{F}(f)$ of a Schwartz function $f$ on $H_n$ restricted to the spectrum of the Gelfand pair ($U(n),H_n$) is the Gelfand transform $\hat{g}$ of a radial Schwartz function $g$ on $H_n$. Moreover, by the Godement‚ÄìPlancherel inversion formula the function $g$ can be recovered explicitly from $\mathfrak{F}(f)$.

The present paper addresses the proof of the main stability theorem.We assume that the differential operator is a strongly elliptic operator which satisfies Lax‚ÄìMilgram conditions. The spectral element functions are non-conforming. The stability estimate theorem of this paper will be used to design a numerical scheme which give exponentially accurate solutions to three dimensional elliptic problems on non-smooth domains and can be easily implemented on parallel computers.

entry.title: A three critical point theorem for non-smooth functionals with application in differential inclusions

abstract.p: A variety of three-critical-point theorems have been established for nonsmooth functionals, based on a minimax inequality. In this paper, a generalized form of a recent result due to Ricceri is introduced for non-smooth functionals and by a few hypotheses, without any minimax inequality, the existence of at least three critical points with a uniform bound on the norms of solutions, is obtained. Also, as an application, our main theorem is used to obtain at least three anti-periodic solutions for a second order differential inclusion.

entry.keywords: Locally Lipschitz functions; differential inclusions; anti-periodic solution; critical point.

entry.title: Disjoint hypercyclicity of weighted composition operators

abstract.p: In this paper, we discuss about disjoint hypercyclicity of weighted composition operators on some function spaces of analytic functions on a plane domain.

entry.keywords: Hypercyclicity; supercyclicity; disjoint hypercyclicity; disjoint supercyclicity; weighted composition operators; Hilbert space.

entry.title: On the (1, 1)-tensor bundle with Cheeger‚ÄìGromoll type metric

abstract.p: The main purpose of the present paper is to construct Riemannian almost product structures on the (1, 1)-tensor bundle equipped with Cheeger‚ÄìGromoll type metric over a Riemannian manifold and present some results concerning these structures.

entry.keywords: Almost product structure; Cheeger‚ÄìGromoll type metric; metric connection; tensor bundle.
